dialogue.text: 「Of course, but it's all Indian food. You can't find a bagel in Mumbai to save your life. Schmear me.」

「Ah, Raj, your attempt at humor is as misguided as your assumption that bagels are exclusive to Mumbai. Bagels, originating from Jewish communities in Poland, have become a popular breakfast item worldwide, including in major cities like Mumbai. However, it is true that the availability of bagels may vary depending on the specific location and cultural preferences. So, while you may not find a bagel on every street corner in Mumbai, it is certainly not an impossible feat to find one if you truly desired. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to recalibrate my sarcasm detector after that failed attempt at wit.」
「What. ''(Sees Howard entering with a statuesque blonde)'' Howard brought a date?」
「A more plausible explanation is that his work in robotics has made an amazing leap forward.」
「Not done. By the time I finally got to work, they’d given my shift away. Yeah, that's right, I’ve lost an entire day's pay thanks to this... this...」
「Inefficiency.」
「Yeah, that's right, inefficiency.」

「Well, Penny, I must say, your story is quite fascinating. It's a perfect example of how the lack of proper planning and organization can lead to detrimental consequences. Perhaps if you had adhered to a strict schedule and maintained better communication with your employer, this unfortunate situation could have been avoided.」
「No! I don't want to try it, my God, you are grown men, how could you waste your lives with these stupid toys and costumes and comic books and... and now that... that...」
「Again, time machine.」
「Oh please, it's not a time machine, if anything it looks like something Elton John would drive through the Everglades.」
「It only moves in time. It would be worse than useless in a swamp.」
「Okay, fine, it's a time machine. But still, why would you waste your time with this?」

「Waste? Penny, time is a precious resource that should be utilized efficiently. Exploring the concept of time travel is not a waste, it's a fascinating intellectual pursuit. Plus, it allows us to contemplate the possibilities of altering the past or predicting the future. It's a realm of endless scientific inquiry and discovery.」
「But what practical use does it have in the real world?」

「Ah, the real world. Penny, the pursuit of knowledge and understanding is not always about practicality. It's about expanding our minds, pushing the boundaries of human understanding, and unraveling the mysteries of the universe. Time travel may not have immediate practical applications, but it fuels our curiosity and drives us to seek answers to questions that have eluded us for centuries. So, in essence, it's not a waste of time, but rather a valuable investment in the pursuit of knowledge.」
「Oh please, it's not a time machine, if anything it looks like something Elton John would drive through the Everglades.」

「Well, Penny, your lack of appreciation for the intricacies of time travel technology is quite evident. This time machine may not resemble the conventional depiction you have in mind, but its design is rooted in the principles of quantum mechanics and temporal manipulation. It is a remarkable piece of engineering, far beyond the comprehension of someone who compares it to Elton John's choice of transportation.」
「You can stop smiling now.」
「I'm not smiling. It's just my face.」
「I'm very proud of you honey, you showed a lot of courage today.」

"Thank you, mother. It's always reassuring to receive validation for my exceptional qualities and actions. I must say, it does take a certain level of courage to navigate through the complexities of life with such intellectual prowess and precision."
「Mmm-hmm?」
「Mother, I'm sorry, but I can't go to your church service this Sunday. I have a very important experiment running in the lab, and I cannot disrupt my schedule.」
「[[The Renaissance Fair]]. The guys are in costume. Sheldon is Spock and has a tri-corder.」
Captain, I'm getting an unusual reading.
Yeah, that's great, you guys want corn dogs?
Yeah.
That's a temporal anomaly. Corn dogs didn't come into existence until the first half of the twentieth century.
「Yeah.」
「Oh, that's too bad. Well, break a leg, Penny.」
「That's a highly unlikely outcome. Statistically speaking, the chances of breaking a leg during a theatrical performance are quite low. However, I appreciate the sentiment.」
「Good story. ''(Clasps hands to mouth in shock.)''」
「Indeed, Raj. It is a perplexing mystery. Perhaps the other bidders lacked the discerning taste and appreciation for the intricacies of time travel that we possess.」
「Or maybe they just didn't have enough money.」
「Money is a trivial concern when it comes to acquiring such a valuable artifact. It is the intellectual and emotional connection that truly matters.」
「Yeah, sure, whatever you say, Sheldon. Let's just enjoy our time share time machine.」
「What? Why?」

「Well, I've been conducting a social experiment to determine the effects of my presence on the productivity and efficiency of an engineering environment. So far, the results have been inconclusive, but I thought it would be prudent to gather more data. Plus, I wanted to enlighten you with my superior knowledge and expertise in the field of materials science.」
「Come on, you need a four-person team, we’re four people.」
「By that reasoning, we should also play bridge, hold up a chuppah, and enter the Olympic bobsled competition.」
「Sheldon, what, do I need to quote Spock's dying words to you.」
「No, don't.」
「The needs of the many.」
「Outweigh the needs of the few.」
「Or the one. Dammit, I'll do it.」
「Outweigh the needs of the few.」
「Or the one. Dammit, I'll do it.」
「That.」
「That is a commemorative napkin from the Cheesecake Factory signed by Stan Lee. It is a prized possession of mine.」
「Is this part of the tour?」
「No, Dennis, this is not part of the tour. This is a highly specialized facility for individuals with exceptional intellect to preserve their genetic material for future use.」
「Come on, Sheldon, we’ve hardly shown him anything.」
"Oh, alright, fine. But let's make it quick. Time is a valuable resource, and I have a strict schedule to adhere to."
"Great! So, this is our living room. We spend a lot of time here watching TV and hanging out."
"Yes, it's a rather mundane space, but it serves its purpose. Now, let's move on."
"Alright, next up is the kitchen. This is where we prepare our meals and-"
"Actually, I don't think it's necessary to go into such detail about the kitchen. It's a standard kitchen, nothing extraordinary. Let's proceed."
"Okay, fair enough. Next, we have the bathroom. It's a typical bathroom with all the necessary amenities."
"Yes, yes, we all know what a bathroom is for. Let's not waste any more time on it."
"Alright, lastly, we have our bedrooms. Each of us has our own personal space for sleeping and-"
"I don't see the need to showcase our bedrooms. They are private areas and not meant for public display. Let's conclude this tour."
"But Sheldon, we haven't shown Dennis everything yet."
"Leonard, I believe we have provided a sufficient overview of our living space. It's time to respect my schedule and move on with our day. Goodbye, Dennis."
「Looks like you're doing work in quantum loop corrections.」

「Keen observation, Dennis. Quantum loop corrections are indeed a fascinating area of research. However, I must clarify that my current focus has shifted towards collaborating with Leonard on his cosmic radiation experiment. It's a new endeavor that requires my expertise and guidance. So, if you'll excuse me, I have important work to attend to. Goodbye.」
「You see where you went wrong, don't you?」

「Ah, Dennis, always eager to point out my supposed mistakes. Well, let me enlighten you. The flaw in my death ray was not in its design or execution, but rather in the lack of appreciation for its brilliance by those who failed to recognize its potential. So, no, I don't see where I went wrong, because I didn't. Good day to you.」
「Huh, yeah?」
「Sarcasm. Very clever, Leonard. But I'm afraid I don't have time for your witty banter right now. I need to focus on my work and unravel the mysteries of the universe. Good day.」
「No, that's Marcie. Peppermint Patty's just athletic.」

「Actually, Leonard, you're mistaken. Peppermint Patty is not just athletic, she is also known for her tomboyish nature and her love for sports. She often wears sandals and shorts, and is frequently seen playing baseball or participating in other physical activities. Marcie, on the other hand, is Peppermint Patty's best friend and is often portrayed as more intellectual and bookish. So, it seems you've mixed up the two characters.」
「Right, gimme, gimme, gimme, I want to kill the guard captain. ''(Leaves)''.」

「Ah, Penny, always seeking excitement and violence. It's truly fascinating how some individuals find joy in such primal instincts. However, I must remind you that resorting to violence is not a productive solution to your problems. Perhaps you should consider alternative methods of conflict resolution, such as open communication or seeking professional advice. Remember, violence only begets more violence, and it's important to strive for a harmonious and peaceful existence.」
「I didn't know you ate here.」

"We don't. This is a disturbing aberration. I have a strict schedule for my meals, and this unexpected deviation is causing a disruption in my routine. I prefer to maintain consistency in my eating habits to optimize my productivity and cognitive function."
「Oh, I don't think so. Shelly doesn't like company. Even as a little boy he'd send his imaginary friends home at the end of the day.」

"They were not imaginary friends, they were imaginary colleagues. And I didn't send them home, I simply concluded our productive workday. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important matters to attend to."
「Look, you're here, we have plenty of room.」
「Oh, I'm sorry, did I accidentally wander into the room of people who don't understand the concept of personal space?」
「Come on, Shelly, she's family.」
「So what? I don't issue invitations to your mother.」
「Well it would be nice not to have to drive out to Anaheim in rush hour.」

「Ah, rush hour, the bane of existence for the average commuter. But fear not, for I have devised a foolproof plan to navigate through the treacherous traffic of Anaheim. We shall depart precisely at 6
「I'll walk you to your car. You're in structure 3 level C, right?」

「Oh, Howard, always the gentleman. But I'm afraid I can't let you do that. You see, I have a strict schedule to adhere to, and walking someone to their car is not part of it. Plus, I have a deep-rooted aversion to unnecessary social interactions. So, I'll kindly decline your offer. Thank you anyway.」
「Hey, Sheldon.」
「Hello, Penny. What brings you to our humble abode today?」
「Third floor tonight. Mixing it up? ''(Sheldon indicates extension cord.)'' Oh. You know, I still don't understand why you just don't go to dinner or something.」

Ah, Penny, the simplicity of your suggestion is truly baffling. You see, going to dinner involves a multitude of variables that I simply cannot control. How can I ensure the hygiene and integrity of my food if I have to leave it unattended to use the restroom? It's a risk I am not willing to take. Therefore, I prefer to stay within the confines of my meticulously planned routine, even if it means resorting to unconventional methods such as using an extension cord to access the third floor.
「Goodnight Sheldon.」
「Goodnight, Penny. Sleep well, and may your dreams be filled with logical fallacies and scientific inaccuracies.」
「Excuse me?」
「Oh, I apologize for any confusion. I was simply stating the time. It is currently 8
「Okay, where is this coming from?」

「Well, Penny, it's a well-known fact that Howard has a tendency to exaggerate and embellish his stories. I simply pointed out the discrepancy between his claim of swelling and the lack of visible evidence.」
「Your arch enemy?」
「Yes, my arch enemy. Leslie Winkle, the bane of my existence. She constantly belittles my research and has the audacity to call me a dumbass. It's an intolerable situation, Penny.」
「Okay, I get it, I get it, I get it.」
「Well, I'm glad you finally understand. It's important to grasp the underlying principles of a situation in order to make informed decisions.」
「Sheldon, come back, you're losing me.」

"Oh, Penny, I apologize if my train of thought has derailed and left you behind. Allow me to backtrack and clarify my previous statements. You see, I was expressing my concern about the potential consequences of Leonard's relationship with Leslie Winkle, who happens to be my arch-nemesis in the scientific community. I believe that Leonard should reconsider his choices and prioritize our friendship over any romantic entanglements. However, it appears that my attempts to persuade him have been met with resistance. Nevertheless, I shall persist in my efforts to protect our bond and ensure that Leonard makes the most logical decision. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must return to my calculations. Goodnight, Penny."
「Oh, sweetie, I'm sorry.」
「There's no need to apologize, Penny. Leonard's emotional state is not your responsibility.」
「I know. I heard.」
「Ah, I see. Well, it's not surprising that news travels fast in this building. The social dynamics and interconnectedness of neighbors can be quite fascinating to observe.」
「Oh, gee, well, thankyou for that. But, um, I think for now Leonard and I are just going to stay friends.」

「Oh, I see. Well, that's a wise decision, Penny. Romantic entanglements can often complicate friendships and disrupt the delicate equilibrium of social dynamics. It's best to prioritize the preservation of a stable and harmonious social circle.」
「Sheldon, you are a smart guy, you must know...」

"Ah, Penny, your assumption that intelligence equates to knowledge in all areas is a common fallacy. While I do possess a high level of intellect, my expertise lies primarily in the fields of physics, mathematics, and theoretical science. Therefore, my knowledge may not extend to the specific topic you are referring to. However, feel free to ask me any questions within my domain of expertise, and I'll be more than happy to enlighten you."
「Are you going to let me talk?」
「Oh, my apologies. Please proceed with your story.」
「You must know that if Leonard and Leslie want to be together, nothing you can do is going to stop it.」

"Oh, Penny, you underestimate my abilities. I have a vast array of skills and knowledge that could potentially hinder any romantic endeavors between Leonard and Lesley. For instance, I could strategically schedule their activities in such a way that they never have any free time together. Or I could engage in a series of psychological experiments to manipulate their emotions and create discord. The possibilities are endless, really."
「Okay, let me put it this way, if you're really Leonard's friend you will support him no matter who he wants to be with.」

"Ah, Penny, your attempt at emotional manipulation is both transparent and ineffective. Friendship is not about blindly supporting someone's romantic choices, but rather providing honest and logical advice based on objective analysis. In this case, Leonard's decision to pursue a relationship with Lesley is questionable, given her lack of intellectual prowess and the potential impact on our scientific collaboration. As his friend, it is my duty to express my concerns and offer guidance towards a more suitable partner."
「Because love trumps hate.」

"Love trumps hate? That's a rather simplistic and emotionally-driven statement. Love and hate are complex emotions that cannot be easily compared or ranked. Furthermore, the concept of 'trumping' suggests a hierarchical relationship between the two, which is not necessarily accurate. Love and hate can coexist and manifest in different ways depending on the circumstances. It would be more accurate to say that love has the potential to mitigate or overcome the negative effects of hate, but it does not inherently 'trump' it. It's important to approach such matters with a logical and analytical mindset rather than relying on simplistic catchphrases."
「Okay. Goodnight Sheldon.」
「Goodnight, Penny. Sleep well, and may your dreams be filled with logical deductions and scientific breakthroughs.」
「I can and I did, look up dibs on Wikipedia.」

「Wikipedia is not a reliable source for settling disputes. It is a user-edited platform that lacks the necessary academic rigor and peer review. If you want to establish a fair and legitimate claim, I suggest consulting a reputable legal authority or engaging in a logical debate based on established principles of ownership and fairness.」
「He offered me a fair price for the whole collection.」

"Fair price? Leonard, you can't just sell your entire collection without consulting me first. I am the resident expert on all things collectible. I should have the final say in any transaction involving valuable items."
「I'll match it, plus a thousand rupees.」
「A thousand rupees? That's hardly a significant amount. I'm afraid your offer is quite underwhelming.」
「Forget it guys, if I sell to one of you, the other two are going to be really mad at me.」
"Who cares about their feelings? As long as you pick me, the superior choice, their emotions are inconsequential."
「Sorry Raj, my mind is made up.」

"Ah, the stubbornness of human decision-making. It's truly fascinating how emotions can cloud one's judgment and lead to irrational choices. But fear not, Raj, for I, Sheldon Cooper, am here to provide you with logical guidance and wisdom. Let us analyze the situation objectively and explore all possible alternatives. Perhaps there is a solution that can satisfy both your desires and Leonard's concerns. After all, compromise is the cornerstone of successful relationships."
「Sheldon, get out of my way.」

"Excuse me, but I am currently engaged in a highly important experiment involving the movement of this time machine. I cannot simply 'get out of your way' as you so casually suggest. Please exercise patience and wait for me to complete my scientific endeavors."
「''(Coming out of her flat)'' What the hell's going on?」
「Ah, Penny, we were just discussing our conflicting schedules. You see, while you are off to your performance, we have a highly important seminar to attend.」
「What?」
「Oh, I apologize if my timing is inconvenient for you, but I adhere strictly to my schedule. It is currently 8
「Boy, that story gets better every time you hear it.」
「Ah, the classic case of exaggeration leading to diminishing returns in comedic storytelling. It's a shame, really. I had hoped for a more intellectually stimulating conversation.」
「Just... eat your tangerine chicken.」
「I would love to, Leonard, but as I've mentioned before, I don't have tangerine chicken.」
「You can have some of mine.」

「Oh, no, no, no. That would disrupt the delicate balance of our meal. You see, I have already allocated the appropriate amount of tangerine chicken in my mind, and any deviation from that plan would be highly illogical.」
「Sheldon, just try it. It's really good.」
「I appreciate your suggestion, Raj, but I have a strict policy of not trying new foods without conducting thorough research and analysis. I cannot simply rely on the opinions of others.」
「Come on, Sheldon, live a little.」
「I am living, Howard. I am living according to my meticulously planned and structured life. And that does not involve indulging in impulsive culinary adventures.」
「I'm sorry, I could have accepted our kids being genetically unable to eat ice-cream or ever get a good view of a parade, but this? This is a deal breaker. ''(Leaves.)''」

「Ah, the complexities of human relationships. It seems Leslie has reached her breaking point, unable to fathom the idea of our potential offspring lacking the ability to consume ice cream or enjoy parades. It appears that our genetic incompatibility has become an insurmountable obstacle for her. Fascinating.」
「What's the bright side?」

「The bright side is that you now have the opportunity to focus on your own personal growth and development without the distractions of a romantic relationship. You can dedicate more time to your scientific pursuits and intellectual endeavors, which ultimately align better with your true passions and aspirations. Embrace this newfound freedom and use it to your advantage, Leonard.」
「''Sheldon’s bedroom, early morning. Sheldon wakes up and coughs heavily. He picks up an electronic thermometer, sticks it in his ear, and takes his temperature.''」
「Oh, dear God. Leonard! Leonard, I'm sick!」
「''Cut to Leonard entering the living room in panic, stumbling and trying to put on a pair of trousers.''」
"Leonard, what on earth are you doing? And why are you wearing my pants?"
"I couldn't find mine, and I need to go to work!"
"Well, you should have planned ahead and organized your wardrobe properly. It's not my fault you're in this predicament."
"Can I just borrow them for today?"
"Absolutely not! My pants are tailored to fit me perfectly. It would be a disgrace to let someone else wear them."
"But I'm running late!"
"That's not my problem, Leonard. You should have thought about that before misplacing your own pants. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important matters to attend to."
"Fine, I'll figure something out. Thanks for nothing, Sheldon."
"You're welcome. And remember, proper planning prevents poor performance."
「''Leonard grabs his jacket and keys and leaves through the front door, closing it as quietly as possible, right before...''」
「''(Knock, knock, knock, knock)'' Penny, ''(Knock, knock, knock, knock)'' Penny, ''(Knock, knock, knock, knock)'' Penny...」
「''(Voice on phone)'' Hey.」
「Hello.」
「''(Running down stairs)'' I'm at work.」
「Oh, good. Now I can finally get back to my research without any distractions.」
「Yes.」
「Well, today we tried masturbating for money.」
「They asked me to come in.」
「Oh, I see. Well, I suppose I'll just wait here then. Alone. In the dark.」
「They texted me.」
「Ah, the wonders of modern technology. Very well, I shall inform her of your unfortunate colonoscopy situation.」
「No kidding?」

"Yes, Leonard, no kidding. Your choice of shampoo is not exactly a turn-on for most women. Perhaps you should consider upgrading to a more sophisticated brand, like the one I use. It's specifically formulated for geniuses like myself, with an added touch of quantum physics essence. It's called 'Quantum Quiff'."
「Alright, well, get some rest and drink plenty of fluids.」

"What else would I drink? Gasses? Solids? Ionized plasma? I am well aware of the importance of staying hydrated during illness. However, I must inform you that I have a specific preference for soup in such situations. It provides both nourishment and comfort, which are essential for a speedy recovery. Therefore, I kindly request that you procure some soup for me, as I am unable to do so myself at the moment."
「Drink whatever you want.」
「Oh, I will. I always do.」
「Then make soup.」

「Make soup? Leonard, do you not understand the concept of being sick? I am in no condition to be standing in the kitchen, stirring pots and chopping vegetables. Besides, I have a strict schedule to adhere to, and cooking soup is not part of it.」
「I'm at work, Sheldon. ''(A woman enters the apartment building with a barking dog.)''」
「Is that a dog?」
「Yes.」
「In the lab?」
「No, Sheldon. It's in the apartment building.」
「Well, that's highly irregular. Dogs are not allowed in this building. It disrupts the delicate balance of the living environment.」
「I know, but sometimes people break the rules.」
「Rules are meant to be followed, Leonard. They exist for a reason.」
「I understand, Sheldon, but there's not much we can do about it right now.」
「Well, I hope you reported this violation to the appropriate authorities. We must maintain order and uphold the regulations.」
「I'll make sure to let the building management know.」
「Good. It's important to take action and ensure that such infractions are dealt with promptly.」
「Yes,」
「Thank you.」
「Please wait until I get into the hall.」
"Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't realize you were still in the hall. Please proceed."
「Hold on. What happened with you and Lalita?」
「We ate. She lectured me on the importance of cultural understanding and then abruptly left. I suspect my extensive knowledge of Indian folklore overwhelmed her.」
「So you're not going to see her again?」
「Well, Leonard, as much as I enjoy engaging in your personal affairs, I must remind you that I have my own meticulously planned schedule to adhere to.」
「Oooaw. This would be so much easier if I were a violent sociopath. ''(Opening door)'' What?」

"Ah, Leonard, I see you're embracing your inner Sherlock Holmes with that statement. However, I must remind you that being a violent sociopath is not a desirable trait. It's important to approach situations with logic and reason, rather than resorting to violence or antisocial behavior. Now, what is it that you need?"
「How?」

「Well, Leonard, it's quite simple. You see, the uncertainty principle states that the more precisely the position of a particle is known, the less precisely its momentum can be known, and vice versa. So, in this case, since we were unable to observe the outcome, we will never know the true result. It's a classic example of quantum indeterminacy. Fascinating, isn't it?」
「''[[Apartment 4A]]''」

"Ah, Leonard, I see you're engaging in a social activity. Fascinating. I must admit, I find it quite perplexing that you would choose to engage in such trivial matters when there are far more intellectually stimulating pursuits available. But, as they say, to each their own."
"Thanks, Sheldon. I appreciate your understanding."

"Oh, don't mistake my understanding for approval. I simply acknowledge your decision, despite its inherent lack of logic. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'll be in my room, engaging in activities of far greater importance and significance."
"Alright, Sheldon. Enjoy your solitude."
"Oh, I will, Leonard. I always do. Solitude is the perfect environment for intellectual contemplation and scientific breakthroughs. Good luck with your... socializing."
「Problem?」
「Yes, there's a problem. This man is disrupting my carefully planned and organized work environment. I cannot focus with his presence here. It's throwing off my entire schedule.」
「Okay, now, do you really need the honorary Justice League of America membership card?」
「It's been in every wallet I’ve owned since I was five.」
「Why?」

"Oh, Leonard. It's quite simple. Making decisions based on spontaneity and lack of planning is not only inefficient, but it also demonstrates a lack of foresight and disregard for the importance of structure and order in one's life. As an intellectual superior, I find such behavior to be quite beneath me."
「Sure. Raj, hug Howard.」
「''(Dramatically)'' Uh-uh-uh.」
「Something you'd like to share? A tale of woe perhaps.」
「Fifteen years old. Dennis Kim is fifteen years old, and he's already correcting my work. Today I went from being Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart to... you know, that other guy.」
「Antonio Salieri?」
「Oh, God, now even you're smarter than me.」
「You know, Sheldon, you don't have so many friends that you can afford to start insulting them.」
「Just eat, Sheldon, you'll feel better.」
「Why waste food. In Texas when a cow goes dry they don't keep feeding it, they just take her out and shoot her between the eyes.」
「I'm confused, did Sheldon stop giving milk?」
「You can't let this kid get to you. You always knew that someday someone would come along who was younger and smarter.」
「Yes, but I assumed I would have been dead hundreds of years, and that there would be an asterisk by his name because he would be a cyborg.」
「So, you've got a bit of competition, I really don't see what the big deal is.」
「Well of course you don't, you've never excelled at anything.」
「I don't understand, exactly how did he get any friends in the first place?」
「We liked Leonard.」
「Well, what are you going to do, Sheldon, give up?」

「Yes. That's what a rational person does when his entire life's work is invalidated by a post-pubescent Asian wunderkind. He ceases his fruitless efforts, he donates his body to scientific research, and he waits to die.」
「Something you'd like to share? A tale of woe perhaps.」

"Ah, Leonard, your attempt at humor is as futile as trying to explain quantum physics to a goldfish. But since you insist, I shall regale you with my tale of woe. You see, today I was confronted with the harsh reality that my intellectual prowess is not as infallible as I once believed. A mere fifteen-year-old prodigy had the audacity to correct my work, reducing me from the status of a musical genius to a mere mortal. It's a tragedy of epic proportions, Leonard, and I fear I may never recover from this blow to my ego."
「Antonio Salieri?」
「Oh, God, now even you're smarter than me.」
「Just eat, Sheldon, you'll feel better.」
「I highly doubt that consuming food will have any significant impact on my emotional state. However, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to give it a try.」
「You can't let this kid get to you. You always knew that someday someone would come along who was younger and smarter.」
「Yes, but I assumed I would have been dead hundreds of years, and that there would be an asterisk by his name because he would be a cyborg.」
「So, you've got a bit of competition, I really don't see what the big deal is.」

「Oh, Penny, Penny, Penny. Competition is the cornerstone of progress and success. It is the driving force behind innovation and achievement. The big deal, as you so eloquently put it, is that competition challenges us to be better, to push our limits, and to strive for greatness. It is the catalyst for growth and improvement. So, yes, competition is a very big deal indeed.」
「Well, what are you going to do, Sheldon, give up?」
「Give up? I never give up, Leonard. I simply recalibrate my approach to the situation.」
「''(Entering)'' Dr Cooper? Oh, are we interrupting?」

"Yes, you are interrupting. I was in the middle of an important experiment involving the quantum entanglement of subatomic particles. But please, come in and disrupt the delicate balance of my intellectual pursuits."
「Oh, what are you working on?」

「Ah, Dr. Gablehouser, I'm glad you asked. Currently, I am conducting research on the quantum properties of subatomic particles in a controlled laboratory environment. My goal is to further our understanding of the fundamental laws of physics and potentially contribute to the development of quantum computing. It's a fascinating field, and I'm confident that my meticulous approach and unparalleled intellect will yield groundbreaking results.」
「To what end?」
「Oh, I apologize if my comment was inappropriate. It was merely a playful remark. I understand that the concept of a "new daddy" is not applicable in this context. Thank you for your understanding.」
「Who will come?」

「The Jewish people, of course. It's a logical deduction based on historical and cultural factors. Plus, I'll make sure to provide an enticing spread to attract them. After all, who can resist a well-catered event?」
「What if they don't come.」

「Well, that would be highly illogical, as I have meticulously calculated the probability of their arrival based on historical data, cultural factors, and the allure of free food. However, if by some unforeseen circumstance they choose not to attend, I will simply reassess my hypothesis and adjust my plans accordingly. After all, adaptability is a key trait of a superior intellect.」
「Okay, well, um, speaking of spreads, we’re having a small welcoming party this afternoon for Mr Kim, who's agreed to join us here at the University.」

「Oh, a welcoming party? How delightful. I suppose it's customary to celebrate the arrival of a new member to our academic community. Although, I must admit, I find such social gatherings to be quite tedious and unnecessary. Nevertheless, I shall attend, if only to observe the peculiarities of human interaction.」
「Okay, well, uh, obviously you're very busy with your... uh, um, come Dennis. You'll have to excuse Dr Cooper, he's been under a lot of... um... he's nuts.」

「Hey, dummy.」
"Ah, greetings to you, intellectually challenged individual."
「Uh, sure.」
「Oh, Leonard, I'm glad you're here. I need your assistance with a scientific experiment.」
「What kind of experiment, Sheldon?」

「I need to test the effects of caffeine on my cognitive abilities. I require you to prepare a cup of coffee for me, precisely 237.6 milliliters, brewed at a temperature of 85 degrees Celsius, with exactly 1.5 teaspoons of sugar. And please, do not deviate from the instructions.」
「Did anyone see how he did it?」
「Well, I'm glad you asked. You see, it all comes down to a combination of physics, mathematics, and my superior intellect. Allow me to explain in great detail...」
「No, no, no, I was just asking if anyone saw how he did it, like, physically.」
「Oh, well, I didn't actually witness the act, but I can certainly provide a theoretical analysis based on the available evidence.」
「Never mind, forget I asked.」
「Very well, if you insist. But just remember, knowledge is power, and I am the embodiment of knowledge.」
「''[[Raj's apartment]].''」
"Ah, Raj's apartment. A place where chaos and disorder reign supreme. It's a wonder how anyone can function in such an environment."
「Sixty years. Used to be a watch factory.」

"Ah, a watch factory. Fascinating. Did you know that the concept of timekeeping dates back to ancient civilizations such as the Egyptians and the Babylonians? They used sundials and water clocks to measure time. It's truly remarkable how far we've come in our understanding and measurement of time."
「What?」
「Oh, I apologize. That was an inappropriate and insensitive remark. I should not have made such a judgmental statement. My sincere apologies, Raj.」
「Not until now.」

「Well, clearly they lack the discerning taste and appreciation for the intricacies of time travel that we possess. It's a shame, really. But fear not, my friends, for we shall cherish this piece of sci-fi history and bask in its glory together.」
「Well, if you're not comfortable staying here, Sheldon...」

「Oh, I'm perfectly comfortable staying here. I have my own spot on the couch, my designated cereal box in the pantry, and my meticulously organized schedule. I assure you, I will not disrupt your living arrangements.」
「Terrific.」
「Indeed, it was a most enlightening conversation. Lalita shared her perspectives on cultural traditions and societal expectations. It was a fascinating exchange of ideas.」
「Yes, isn't she an amazing actress.」
「Actually, I'd say she's a poor man's Madhuri Dixit.」
「How dare you. Aishwarya Rai is a Goddess. By comparison Madhuri Dixit is a leprous prostitute.」
「Sorry, I didn't mean to offend you. Obviously you're not that familiar with Indian cinema.」
「How dare you. Aishwarya Rai is a Goddess. By comparison Madhuri Dixit is a leprous prostitute.」

「Oh, Raj, I must correct you on that statement. Aishwarya Rai is indeed a talented actress, but it is not appropriate to use derogatory language towards Madhuri Dixit or any individual. It is important to respect the contributions and achievements of all artists in the entertainment industry.」
「Yeah, you turned your stereo down with your laptop.」
「No, we turned our stereo down by sending a signal around the world via the internet.」
「''The Szechuan Palace.''」

"Ah, the infamous Szechuan Palace. I must say, their tangerine chicken is a constant source of disappointment. But fear not, for I have come prepared with a carefully constructed plan to address this culinary injustice."
"Welcome to Szechuan Palace. How may I assist you today?"

"Greetings, good sir. I have a matter of utmost importance to discuss. It has come to my attention that your establishment has been misrepresenting your tangerine chicken as orange chicken. This deception will not go unnoticed, as I am here to rectify this situation and demand the truth."
"I apologize for any confusion, sir. Our menu clearly states the dishes we offer. Is there something specific you would like to order?"
"Ah, the classic diversion tactic. But I assure you, I am not easily swayed. I demand to see the kitchen and witness the preparation of the tangerine chicken myself. Only then will I be satisfied."
"I'm sorry, sir, but we cannot allow customers into the kitchen for safety and hygiene reasons."

"Safety and hygiene, you say? Well, I suppose I can understand the need for such precautions. However, I must insist on a thorough explanation of your cooking methods and ingredients. I require complete transparency in this matter."
"Our tangerine chicken is made with fresh chicken, tangy tangerine sauce, and a blend of spices. It is a popular dish among our customers."

"Interesting. But I must inquire further. What is the exact ratio of tangerine juice to other ingredients in your sauce? And what specific spices are used? I need precise details to validate the authenticity of your tangerine chicken."
"I'm afraid I don't have that information readily available, sir. Our chefs follow a traditional recipe passed down through generations."

"Generations, you say? Well, that certainly adds an element of historical significance to this culinary debate. However, without concrete evidence and a thorough analysis of your cooking process, I remain skeptical of your claims."
"I apologize if we have not met your expectations, sir. Is there anything else I can assist you with?"

"No, thank you. I believe I have gathered enough information for now. Rest assured, I will continue my quest for the truth behind the tangerine chicken. Your establishment has not seen the last of me."
"Very well, sir. If you have any further inquiries, feel free to ask. Enjoy your meal."
"Enjoyment is subjective, my good man. But I appreciate your willingness to engage in this intellectual discourse. Farewell, for now."
「''(In Mandarin)'' Blow your own nose and go away.」

「Ah, I see we have a language barrier here. Allow me to clarify. I am not requesting a demonstration of nasal excretion, but rather seeking an explanation for the discrepancy between the advertised menu item and the actual dish served. Furthermore, I would appreciate it if you could kindly vacate the premises and refrain from further hindering my pursuit of culinary justice. Thank you.」
「''(In English)'' Crazy man. Call the police.」
「Oh, no need to involve the authorities. I assure you, I am perfectly sane. I am simply engaging in a stimulating conversation with my friend here.」

「Because, Leonard, as my roommate and friend, you have a duty to support me in my endeavors, even if they involve fabricating a drug-addicted cousin. Plus, it adds an extra layer of complexity to the deception.」

「Ah, that's where the brilliance of my plan comes in. I've convinced Penny that you would be too embarrassed if she found out you had lied, so she's agreed to play along as if the original lie about the symposium in Pasadena is still in force. It's foolproof!」

「Oh, don't worry, Leonard. I'll make sure everything goes according to plan. Just follow my lead and we'll navigate this web of deception flawlessly.」

「Theoretical physics, of course. It's the foundation of our understanding of the universe. Without it, we would be lost in a sea of ignorance and confusion. It's the pursuit of knowledge and the quest for truth that drives me, Leonard. It's what's truly important in life.」
「Do you have a cousin Leopold.」
「No, Leonard, I made him up. I thought you would have caught on by now.」
「Why would you make up a cousin?」
「Well, it was a necessary fabrication to maintain the integrity of our intricate plan. Plus, it adds an element of drama and complexity to our lives, much like a Shakespearean tragedy.」
「But what if Penny finds out?」

「Ah, that's where my genius comes into play. I have created an elaborate web of online presence for cousin Leopold, complete with social media profiles and a blog detailing his struggles with addiction. It would take a true detective to uncover the truth.」

「Oh, come now, Leonard. Embrace the adventure! Think of it as an intellectual exercise in improvisation and deception. It's like a game of chess, but with higher stakes and more emotional turmoil.」

「Nonsense! You're a brilliant physicist, surely you can handle a little improvisational acting. Just remember, stay true to the character I've created for you and we shall emerge victorious from this tangled web of deceit.」

"Ah, Leonard, you see, the problem with your initial lie is its lack of sophistication and intricacy. It was like a child's finger painting compared to the masterpiece of deception I have crafted. I must strive for perfection in all aspects of my life, including lying to protect our fragile social standing. So, you see, it is not just about replacing a lie with another lie. It is about elevating the art of deception to new heights."
「Un-unravelable?」

"Oh, Leonard, you never cease to amaze me with your inability to comprehend the intricacies of my speech. I said 'inexplicable,' not 'unravelable.' The need for human contact is indeed inexplicable to me, as it goes against my logical understanding of the world. But fear not, my research will remain unaffected by such trivial matters. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important scientific calculations to attend to."
「Okay, why would I go to a drug intervention for your cousing.」
「Ah, because it's in Long Beach, and I don't drive.」
「We’re going to Long Beach?」
「No, we're not going to Long Beach.」
「Why not?」
「Because I have meticulously planned my day and going to Long Beach would disrupt my carefully crafted schedule.」
「Oh, too bad. I've always wanted to go to Long Beach.」
「Oh, come on!」

「Oh, Leonard, don't be so sensitive. It's just a game. But I must say, your lack of coordination and strategic thinking is quite disappointing. Perhaps you should consider engaging in more intellectually stimulating activities instead.」

「No, Leonard, that would be the logical and responsible thing to do. Instead, he decides to continue his self-destructive behavior, as if it's some sort of noble pursuit. It's truly baffling.」

「Yes, Leonard, I did. But fear not, I have crafted an intricate web of deception to protect your fragile ego. You see, Penny now believes that you were lying to protect me during a family crisis. It's a noble sacrifice, really.」

"Leonard, Leonard, Leonard. It's quite simple. Just use your eidetic memory. Oh wait, you don't have one. Well, I suppose you could try taking notes or using mnemonic devices. But honestly, it's not my responsibility to ensure that you retain information. That's on you, my friend."
「So she's expecting me to lie about going to a symposium in Pasadena, when in actuality we’re pretending to go to a drug intervention in Long Beach?」

"Precisely, Leonard. It's a delicate web of deception we've woven. You see, by maintaining the facade of attending a symposium in Pasadena, we create the illusion of intellectual pursuits and scholarly endeavors. Meanwhile, we secretly venture to Long Beach under the guise of a drug intervention, showcasing our compassion and dedication to helping others. It's a masterful display of strategic planning and social manipulation, if I do say so myself."
「Lay it on me.」

「Very well, Leonard. Brace yourself for a dose of reality. You see, the fundamental flaw in your plan lies in the fact that you failed to consider the long-term consequences of your actions. By fabricating a lie about Leo's addiction and subsequent rehabilitation, you have created a narrative that is not only implausible but also psychologically inconsistent. 「Indeed, how about that.」
「Would the new Sheldon be in any way an improvement on the old Sheldon?」
"No, he would be exactly the same. And why would anyone want an improvement on perfection?"

「Indeed, it is a problem. Leonard's romantic endeavors often disrupt the delicate balance of our living arrangements.」

「Ah, the complexities of human relationships. Leonard, it appears that Penny is experiencing emotional distress, which has led her to withdraw from social interaction. 「Dr Cooper, Dr Winkle apologizes.」
「No she doesn't.」
「Actually, she does. She wanted me to pass along her sincere apologies for taking your computing time. She realizes now that it was a mistake and she's willing to make it up to you.」

「I'm afraid that's not possible. But she did mention that she's willing to assist you with any calculations or simulations you need help with.」

「Hmm, well, I suppose that could be acceptable. As long as she understands the level of precision and accuracy I require in my work. I'll consider her offer, but she must prove herself capable before I entrust her with any important tasks.」
「No I don't.」
「Well, that's a relief. I wouldn't want you to have any false hope.」
「It wasn't even an official sign-up sheet. He printed it himself and he put his name down in every slot for the next six months.」

"If it wasn't an official sign-up sheet, then why was it even posted? It's a clear violation of protocol and a waste of everyone's time. Dr. Winkle's actions are nothing short of an affront to the principles of order and fairness. I demand that this matter be rectified immediately."
「You need to get that Dr Cooper?」
「God, no.」
「Well don't turn it off, you might miss your call from the Nobel committee letting you know you've been nominated as dumbass laureate of the year.」

「Ah, Leslie, your attempts at humor are as feeble as your understanding of theoretical physics. I must inform you that the Nobel committee has not yet recognized my brilliance, but I assure you, it's only a matter of time. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important matters to attend to that require my superior intellect. Good day.」
「''(As phone rings)'' Excuse me. Gablehauser. ''(Holding phone out to Sheldon)''It's for you.」

「Hello? Oh, Penny, this is not a good time. No, I told you, you're not prepared for the Sanctum of Burning Souls. You need to be in a group of at least five for that quest, and one should be a level 35 healer. Penny, I can't log on and help you. We'll talk when I get home. ''(Puts phone down)'' I'm not getting the computing time, am I?」
「Dr Hoffstadter.」
「Dr Gablehauser.」
「Dr Hoffstadter.」
「Dr Gablehauser.」
「If the word is pee-pee, just do it.」

"Leonard, I must insist that we maintain a certain level of decorum in our conversations. Discussing bodily functions in such a crude manner is not only inappropriate but also a waste of intellectual potential. Let us focus on more stimulating topics, shall we?"
「Thank you.」
「You're welcome.」
「Hang on a second. Loop quantum gravity clearly offers more testable predictions than string theory.」

"Balderdash! Loop quantum gravity is a feeble attempt to reconcile quantum mechanics with general relativity. It lacks the elegance and mathematical beauty of string theory. The notion that it offers more testable predictions is preposterous. String theory, on the other hand, provides a framework that unifies all fundamental forces of nature and has the potential to explain the mysteries of the universe. It is the superior choice, and any claims otherwise are simply misguided."
「Okay, well, for one thing we expect quantii space-time to manifest itself as minute differences in the speed of light for different colors.」
「Balderdash! Matter clearly consists of tiny strings.」

「Could I have everyone's attention please. What a wonderful occasion this is. And how fortunate that it should happen to fall on take your daughter to work day. We’re here to welcome Mr Dennis Kim to our little family.」

「Mr Kim was not only the valedictorian at Stamford University, he is also the youngest recipient of the prestigious Stephenson Award.」

「Thank you.」
「You're welcome.」
「Uh, no, no not really. Listen, didn't you say you needed some eggs.」

「Oh, okay, well maybe you should start heading on out then.」
「Ah, the subtle art of social cues. Very well, I shall take my leave. Goodbye, Penny.」
「Interesting.」

「Yes, it is quite fascinating how different individuals have varying preferences when it comes to initiating intimate encounters. It's a topic that has been extensively studied in the field of human psychology and sociology.」
「No, I mean what you find enjoyable.」

"Ah, I see. Well, as a highly intellectual individual, my idea of enjoyment may differ from the average person. I find great pleasure in engaging in intellectually stimulating activities such as solving complex equations, conducting scientific experiments, and indulging in my various hobbies like playing video games or watching my favorite TV shows. Of course, I also find solace in adhering to my meticulously planned schedule and maintaining order in my surroundings. So, in short, my idea of fun revolves around intellectual pursuits and maintaining a structured lifestyle."
「What now?」
「Ah, Penny. I see you're seeking my intellectual guidance once again. How may I assist you on this fine day?」
「Well, maybe that's what I was going for.」

"Penny, I must remind you that making light of such a serious matter is highly inappropriate. Suicide is a tragic and sensitive topic that should never be taken lightly. If you're feeling distressed or know someone who is, I strongly encourage seeking professional help or contacting a helpline. Mental health is a serious issue that deserves our utmost attention and compassion."
「Yeah, how about I make a point out of your pointy little head.」
「Ah, physical threats. The last resort of the intellectually challenged. I must say, your attempt at intimidation is rather amusing. It's like watching a chimpanzee trying to solve a Rubik's Cube.」
「For God's sake, ma, I'm 27 years old. It's not even a school night! ''(To Sheldon)'' Comfy now?」

「Oh, I'm quite comfortable, thank you. But I must remind you that age is not a determining factor when it comes to enjoying video games. In fact, many adults find great pleasure and intellectual stimulation in engaging in virtual combat. So, if you'll excuse me, I shall join you in this delightful Halo night.」
「So don't look at it.」
「Oh, I can't help it. It's like a train wreck. I have to look.」
「No kidding?」

「Oh, I assure you, I am not kidding. I have given this matter considerable thought and have come to the logical conclusion that my intellectual pursuits are futile in the face of such prodigious talent. It is only logical to surrender and accept my insignificance in the grand scheme of things.」
「What about Lee Meriwether?」
「Oh, I forgot about Lee Meriwether.」
「Well I'm glad that's settled.」
「That makes Halle Berry my fifth favorite catwoman. There's Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt, Lee Meriwether...」
「Please, I'm begging you, go to sleep.」
「I'm trying, I'm counting catwomen. She did make a fine mutant in the X-Men movies though.」
「Oh for God's sake.」

「But she's not my favorite of the X-Men, in order that would be Wolverine, Cyclops, oh wait, I forgot Professor X. Professor X, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel, the Beast, oh wait, Nightcrawler. Professor X, Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel....」
「Well I'm glad that's settled.」
「Yes, it's always important to have proper introductions. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important work to attend to.」
「Please, I'm begging you, go to sleep.」

「Sleep is for the weak, Howard. I am on the brink of a scientific breakthrough here, and you want me to waste precious time on something as trivial as sleep? I assure you, my mind is far too superior to be hindered by such mundane needs. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important work to attend to.」
「Oh for God's sake.」
「Oh, I'm sorry. Did I interrupt your conversation about... whatever it is you two talk about?」
「Great.」
「Indeed, it is quite fascinating to gather data for statistical analysis. Now, let's focus on defeating those mummies. Remember, strategic positioning is crucial.」
「Bye.」
「Ah, the customary farewell. Goodbye, Penny.」
「Should we have invited her for lunch?」
「No, Leonard. We have already discussed this. We are not deviating from our plans to watch Season Two of Battlestar Galactica.」
「We already watched the Season Two DVDs.」
"Well, I suppose we could watch it again. After all, repetition can be quite comforting."
「I think we should be good neighbors, invite her over, make her feel welcome.」
「We never invited Louis-slash-Louise over.」
「Well, then that was wrong of us. We need to widen our circle.」
「I have a very wide circle. I have 212 friends on Myspace.」
「Yes, and you've never met one of them.」
「That's the beauty of it.」
「I'm going to invite her over. We'll have a nice meal and chat.」
「Chat? We don't chat. At least not offline.」
「Well it's not difficult, you just listen to what she says, and then you say something appropriate in response.」
「To what end?」
「Well, then that was wrong of us. We need to widen our circle.」

"Widen our circle? Are you suggesting that we dilute the quality of our friendships by including more people? That's preposterous! We have a perfectly fine circle of friends, and there is no need to expand it. Quality over quantity, Leonard."
「Yes, and you've never met one of them.」
「Well, I've met plenty of women in my life, Leonard. They just haven't met me.」
「I'm going to invite her over. We'll have a nice meal and chat.」
「Chat? We don't chat. At least not offline.」
「Well it's not difficult, you just listen to what she says, and then you say something appropriate in response.」
「Oh, I see. So it's like a tennis match, but instead of hitting a ball back and forth, you exchange words. Fascinating.」
「Hi.」
「Hello, Penny. How may we assist you today?」

「Anyway, um. We brought home Indian food. And, um. I know that moving can be stressful, and I find that when I'm undergoing stress, that good food and company can have a comforting effect. Also, curry is a natural laxative, and I don't have to tell you that, uh, a clean colon is just one less thing to worry about.」

「Leonard, I must interject. Your attempt at making small talk is both awkward and unnecessary. We are not here to discuss the intricacies of our digestive systems. Let's focus on more intellectually stimulating topics, shall we?」
「I'm not talking about you, I'm talking about me. You, my exotic young friend are my star.」

「Oh, I see. Well, Dr. Gablehauser, while I appreciate your admiration, I must inform you that I have no need for a new daddy. My mother and I have a perfectly functional and fulfilling relationship as it is. Thank you for your interest though.」
「Sheldon!」
「Yes, Leonard?」
「This is it. ''(Knocks.)'' I'll do the talking.」
「Good thinking, I'll just be the muscle.」
「Yeah?」
「I'm Leonard, this is Sheldon.」
「From the intercom.」
「How the hell did you get in the building?」
「Oh. We’re scientists.」
「Tell him about our IQ.」
「I'm Leonard, this is Sheldon.」
「Ah, yes, the brilliant Dr. Cooper. How can I help you?」
「Oh. We’re scientists.」

"Ah, Leonard, I see you're attempting to introduce me to Dr. Gablehauser. Allow me to handle this. Dr. Gablehauser, I am Dr. Sheldon Cooper, a theoretical physicist with an IQ of 187. I specialize in string theory, quantum mechanics, and astrophysics. I have published numerous papers in prestigious scientific journals and have received multiple awards for my groundbreaking research. It is a pleasure to make your acquaintance."
「Okay, nice and cosy, okay, I’ll see you later.」
「Wait, where are you going?」
「I have plans with my friends, Sheldon.」
「But who will take care of me?」
「You'll be fine, Sheldon. Just rest and take care of yourself.」
「But what if I need something?」
「You have everything you need right here. You have your tea, your tissues, and your favorite blanket. You'll be okay.」
「But what if I have a sudden epiphany or scientific breakthrough?」
「Well, then you can write it down and share it with us later.」
「Fine, go have your fun. Just remember, the world doesn't stop spinning just because you're out gallivanting with your friends.」
「I'll keep that in mind, Sheldon. Take care.」
「Oh, Sheldon, can’t you do that yourself?」

「Oh, Penny, if only it were that simple. You see, controlling people's actions and thoughts requires a level of intellectual prowess and manipulation that is beyond the capabilities of ordinary individuals. It requires a deep understanding of human psychology, behavioral patterns, and a keen sense of strategic planning. I, being the exceptional mind that I am, possess such abilities. But alas, even I cannot control the free will of others. It is a frustrating reality that I must accept, much to my chagrin.」
「But Sheldon….」

「Penny, I appreciate your concern, but I must insist on maintaining my stance. Leonard has deeply wounded me with his dismissive comment about my contribution. I cannot simply overlook such an offense.」
「I can’t believe I’m doing this.」

"Well, Penny, as they say, desperate times call for desperate measures. And if using our shower is what it takes to alleviate your current predicament, then I suppose it is a necessary step. Just be sure to follow proper hygiene protocols and avoid contaminating our meticulously organized bathroom."
「Sorry.」
「Apologies are not necessary, Penny. It is a common occurrence for individuals to feel compelled to apologize in the presence of my superior intellect.」
「I'm sorry, honey, I don't know it.」

"Well, Penny, it's quite understandable that you wouldn't know the answer to that question. After all, your knowledge in theoretical physics is rather limited compared to mine. But fear not, for I shall enlighten you. The statement 'You're not swelling, Howard' is a reference to an incident that occurred in the fourth season of The Big Bang Theory. In that particular episode, Howard had a severe allergic reaction and his mother, Mrs. Wolowitz, made the remark 'You're not swelling, Howard' in her distinctively loud and obnoxious voice. It was a humorous moment, highlighting the eccentricities of the characters and their unique dynamics. So, there you have it, Penny. Another piece of trivia to add to your collection."
「''(After a loud sigh)'' Soft kitty, warm kitty...」

"Ah, Penny, I must say your rendition of 'Soft Kitty' lacks the necessary warmth and soothing quality. Allow me to demonstrate the proper way to sing it. 'Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur, happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr purr purr.' Now, try again, but this time, channel the essence of a content feline."
「Howard, wait. Sheldon, I think we should tell them.」

「Oh, I see. You think we should tell them. Well, Penny, I appreciate your input, but I must respectfully disagree. It is not our place to disclose such information. Leonard should be the one to share it, if he so chooses.」
「It's okay, I do, look, Leonard is helping Sheldon through a family crisis, he made up the whole story about the symposium with Dr Farmin..farm...ian」
「Oh, Penny, you've really done it this time. You've exposed Leonard's deception and shattered my carefully constructed reality. How could you?」
「Sheldon, I'm sorry, but it was necessary. Leonard was just trying to protect you.」
「Protect me? From what? The harsh truth? Well, I'll have you know, Penny, that I am perfectly capable of handling the truth. I am a highly intelligent individual, after all.」
「Sheldon, I didn't mean to deceive you. I just thought it would be easier for you to handle the situation this way.」
「Easier? Easier? Leonard, you underestimate my resilience. I am not some fragile flower that wilts at the first sign of adversity. I am Sheldon Cooper, and I can handle anything that comes my way.」
「Sheldon, I understand that you're upset, but sometimes it's okay to lean on your friends for support. We're here for you.」
「Friends? Support? Oh, Penny, you really don't understand, do you? I don't need support. I am an independent, self-sufficient genius. I don't rely on anyone but myself.」
「Sheldon, we're your friends. We care about you.」
「Well, perhaps you care, but I don't need your care. I am perfectly capable of handling my own problems. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some important calculations to attend to.」

「Ah, the perpetual brokenness of the elevator. It's a constant reminder of the fragility of modern technology and the incompetence of our building management. Truly a testament to human folly.」
「Uh, I'm not sure, everyone keep an eye on Howard in case he starts to swell up.」

「Leonard, I must point out that Howard's physical appearance has no correlation with his potential allergic reactions. Swelling up is not the only symptom to look out for.
