「Well, this is nice. We don't have a lot of company over.」

"Yes, well, that's because we prefer to maintain a controlled and predictable environment in our living space. It helps to optimize our cognitive functions and minimize unnecessary social interactions."
「Yes, I know, but...」

「But what? You're going to rely on chance and spontaneity? That's not how successful relationships are formed, Leonard. You need a well-thought-out plan, a logical approach, and a comprehensive analysis of compatibility factors. Winging it is simply not an acceptable strategy.」
「Yes, I remember.」
「Of course you do, Leonard. Your memory is like a steel trap, rusty and illegal in 37 states.」
「I'm sorry.」
「Apologies are not enough, Leonard. You have violated Penny's trust and invaded her personal space. This is a serious breach of social boundaries and it is imperative that you make amends.」
「Um, me, okay, I'm Sagittarius, which probably tells you way more than you need to know.」

「Yes, it tells us that you participate in the mass cultural delusion that the Sun's apparent position relative to arbitrarily defined constellations and the time of your birth somehow affects your personality.」
「Oh, yeah, a lot of people think I'm a water sign. Okay, let's see, what else, oh, I'm a vegetarian, oh, except for fish, and the occasional steak, I love steak.」
「Ah, the classic case of selective vegetarianism. It's like saying you're a pacifist, except for the occasional punch in the face.」
「Oh, okay. I love cheesecake.」

「Cheesecake is a derivative of the ancient Greek dish known as "plakous". It was served to the athletes during the first Olympic Games in 776 BC. So, while you may enjoy it, I find it rather unremarkable.」
「The university cafeteria.」
"Ah, the university cafeteria. A place where culinary mediocrity thrives and nutritional nightmares come to life. It's a wonder anyone can find sustenance in this den of gastronomic despair."
"Sheldon, we're just here to grab a quick bite."
"Yes, Leonard, I am well aware of our purpose. However, one cannot simply ignore the abysmal quality of the food offerings in this establishment. It's a travesty, really."
"Okay, Sheldon, let's just get our food and find a table."
"Very well, Leonard. But I must warn you, my discerning taste buds will not be easily satisfied by the subpar fare that awaits us. Proceed with caution."
「''A Chinese restaurant.''」

"Ah, the Szechuan Palace. A place of culinary deception and questionable authenticity. I must say, I am here not for the pleasure of dining, but rather to address a grave matter of misrepresentation. You see, I have reason to believe that the tangerine chicken they serve is, in fact, nothing more than a deceitful impostor, masquerading as the genuine article. I intend to confront them and demand an explanation for this culinary charade."
「We can't order Chinese food without Wolowitz?」

"Oh, Leonard, Leonard. How can you not understand the intricacies of our Chinese food ordering system? Our entire order is carefully planned and divided amongst the four of us. Without Wolowitz, our delicate balance is disrupted. It's like trying to solve a complex equation without all the variables. It simply cannot be done."
「I see ''a'' problem.」
「Well, if you see ''a'' problem, then it's your responsibility to fix it. I have a strict schedule to adhere to and I cannot be bothered with such trivial matters. Goodbye.」
「So, we'll just order three entrees.」

"No, no, no! That would disrupt the delicate balance of our meal plan. We cannot simply eliminate an entree and expect everything to be fine. It's a mathematical impossibility. We need all four entrees to maintain the equilibrium of flavors and textures. It's a matter of culinary harmony, Leonard."
「We could cut it into thirds.」
「Then it is no longer a dumpling. Once you cut it open, it is at best a very small open-faced sandwich.」
「Hi fellas. Oh, where's your annoying little friend who thinks he speaks Mandarin?」
"Ah, you must be referring to me, the highly intelligent and linguistically gifted individual who is currently absent from this gathering. How may I assist you?"
「What are you doing?」
「I'm conducting an experiment to determine the precise location of the center of the universe within our apartment.」
「And how exactly are you planning to do that?」
「By observing the patterns of cosmic microwave background radiation and analyzing the spatial distribution of matter in the universe.」
「But we're in an apartment, Sheldon.」
「Yes, precisely. By studying the distribution of matter within our confined space, we can extrapolate its position relative to the larger universe. It's a groundbreaking research, Leonard.」
「I'm not sure if that's how it works, Sheldon.」
「Of course it is. I have a PhD in theoretical physics, I know what I'm doing. Now, please don't disturb me, I'm in the middle of an important scientific endeavor.」
「Penny's still sleeping.」
「Ah, the beauty of a peaceful slumber. It's a shame to disturb such tranquility, isn't it? But fear not, Leonard, for I have a solution. We shall employ the ancient art of tiptoeing.」
「Tiptoeing? Seriously?」

「Indeed. Tiptoeing is a time-honored technique used to navigate silently and avoid waking the sleeping beauty. It requires finesse, precision, and a deep understanding of the physics of weight distribution. Shall we proceed?」
「Fine, let's tiptoe.」

「Excellent. Remember, Leonard, the key is to distribute your weight evenly across the balls of your feet, minimizing the impact on the floor. And for goodness sake, control your breathing. We don't want any unnecessary noise.」
「Got it. Tiptoeing, even weight distribution, controlled breathing. Let's go.」
「Onward, my stealthy companion. May our tiptoeing skills rival those of the greatest ninjas in history.」
「I know, I know, look, you have a TV in your room, why don't you just have breakfast in bed?」
「Because I am neither an invalid nor a woman celebrating Mother's Day.」
「You okay?」

「No, Leonard, I am not okay. I am suffering from a severe case of nasal congestion, which is impeding my ability to breathe properly and causing great discomfort. I require immediate assistance in obtaining the necessary tools to alleviate this condition.」
「So Penny's a little messy.」

"A little messy? That's an understatement of astronomical proportions! The state of Penny's living space is a clear violation of the laws of order and cleanliness. It's as if chaos itself has taken up residence in her apartment. I must say, it's quite perplexing how someone can function in such an environment. It defies all logical reasoning and organizational principles. I simply cannot comprehend it."
「Did it ever occur to you that not everyone has the compulsive need to sort, organize and label the entire world around them?」

No, Leonard, it hasn't occurred to me because it's a fundamental truth that the world would be a much more efficient and harmonious place if everyone did have the compulsive need to sort, organize, and label. Chaos breeds chaos, Leonard, and chaos is the enemy of progress and productivity. It's a simple concept that seems to elude the majority of the population, but luckily, I am here to enlighten them.
「Well they don't. Hard as it may be for you to believe, most people don't sort their breakfast cereal numerically by fibre content.」

"Oh, Leonard, you underestimate the importance of organization and efficiency in one's daily life. Sorting breakfast cereal by fiber content is not only logical, but it ensures optimal nutritional intake and digestive health. It's a shame that most people don't appreciate the benefits of such meticulous categorization."
「Come on, we should go.」
「But I'm not finished with my experiment yet.」
「Sheldon, we need to leave now.」
「But my routine, my schedule! It's all disrupted!」
「I know, Sheldon, but sometimes we have to adapt to unexpected situations.」
「Adapt? That's preposterous! I thrive on structure and predictability!」
「I understand, but right now, we have to prioritize our safety and well-being.」
「Fine, but I expect a detailed report on the consequences of this disruption to my routine.」
「Sure, Sheldon, I'll make a note of it. Now, let's go.」
「Sheldon, this is not your home.」
「Of course it's not my home, Leonard. It's merely a temporary residence until I find a suitable living arrangement that meets my specific requirements.」
「When the transvestite lived here, you didn't care how he kept the place.」
「That's not a fair comparison. Dennis Kim was a meticulous housekeeper. He had a system for everything, and he followed it religiously. Plus, he never used my toothbrush.」
「What were you doing in his closet?」
「I was merely organizing his closet according to a logical system based on color, fabric, and seasonality. It's a shame that Leonard lacks the organizational skills to maintain a proper wardrobe.」
「Great. Was it hard getting it up the stairs?」

「Oh, Penny, I must correct you. It is not appropriate to discuss such matters in public. The transportation of objects up the stairs is a trivial concern compared to the intellectual pursuits that occupy my mind.」
「Okay, great, thank you again ''(she throws her jacket over the back of the sofa).''」

「You're welcome. Oh, and by the way, you might want to be careful with your jacket. It's not advisable to throw it over the back of the sofa like that. It can cause unnecessary wrinkles and damage to the fabric. It's best to hang it properly on a coat hanger or place it in a designated area for jackets. Just a friendly suggestion for maintaining the longevity of your clothing.」
「And he's only fifteen years old.」
「Not bad, I myself started graduate school at fourteen.」
「Sheldon, don't make that noise, it's disrespectful.」
「I apologize if my noise was perceived as disrespectful. It was merely an involuntary reaction to this unexpected encounter.」
「No, I said animalistic. Of course we’re all animals, but some of us have climbed a little higher on the evolutionary tree.」

"Ah, Leonard, your attempt at a witty comeback is commendable, but let's not forget that intelligence is not solely determined by one's position on the evolutionary tree. It requires a combination of genetic predisposition, environmental factors, and of course, a superior intellect like mine. So, while we may all be animals, it's clear that some of us have ascended to a higher level of cognitive prowess."
「So what, I'm unevolved?」

"Oh, no, no, no, Kurt. It's not about being unevolved. It's just that some of us have evolved in different ways, intellectually speaking. It's like comparing a chimpanzee to a human. Sure, they share some similarities, but the cognitive abilities and problem-solving skills are on completely different levels. So, in that sense, yes, you could say there's a disparity in our evolutionary paths."
「Uh, how about a grasshopper. I make a mean grasshopper. Okay? Good. Coming up. Sheldon, what are you going to have?」
「I'll have a virgin Cuba libre.」
「That's, um, rum and coke without the rum.」
「Yes, and would you make it diet?」
「There's a can in the fridge.」
「A Cuba libre traditionally comes in a tall glass with a lime wedge.」
「Then swim to Cuba. Bartenders are supposed to have people skills.」
「Well, I suppose I'll have to make do with your subpar bartending skills.」
「Okay, can you please order a cocktail, I need to practice mixing drinks.」

"Ah, Penny, I must inform you that I have a strict policy against consuming alcoholic beverages. As a man of science, I prefer to keep my mind clear and focused at all times. However, I understand your need to practice your mixology skills. Perhaps you could create a non-alcoholic concoction for me to evaluate and provide feedback on?"
「That's, um, rum and coke without the rum.」

「Yes, a virgin Cuba libre. It's a fascinating concept, isn't it? Removing the alcohol from a cocktail, essentially rendering it a mere concoction of carbonated beverage and lime. It's a testament to the human ability to derive pleasure from the illusion of indulgence without the actual substance. Quite intriguing, wouldn't you agree?」
「So coke.」
「Yes, and would you make it diet?」
「There's a can in the fridge.」
「A can? That's not labeled 'mucus'! How can I trust the contents of an unlabeled can? It could be anything!」
「It's chicken noodle soup, Sheldon. It'll help with your congestion.」
「Chicken noodle soup? That's a common remedy for the common cold. I require a more sophisticated solution.」
「Well, I'm sorry if my common remedies don't meet your high standards, Sheldon. Maybe you should find your own solution then.」
「Fine, I will. I'll conduct a thorough research on the most effective remedies for nasal congestion and create my own concoction.」
「Sheldon, just have the soup. It'll make you feel better.」
「I don't need your amateur medical advice, Leonard. I'll find a solution that aligns with my superior intellect.」
「Then swim to Cuba.」

「Swimming to Cuba is not a viable option, Penny. It's approximately 90 miles away from Key West, Florida. Even if one were an exceptional swimmer, the distance and potential dangers, such as strong currents and marine wildlife, make it an impractical endeavor. It would be more logical to take a flight or a boat to reach Cuba.」

「Yeah, that's terrific, but what they wanted me to ask you was to cut it the hell out. ''(To someone off)'' Right come on guys, come on. ''(Singing while approaching another table)'' Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you...」

「Penny, I must interject. Singing the traditional birthday song in a public setting is not only a violation of copyright law, but also a social convention that I find highly unnecessary and inefficient. Might I suggest a more efficient and legally compliant alternative?」
「Oh, really? And what would that be, Sheldon?」
「A simple nod of acknowledgement and a heartfelt 'Happy birthday' would suffice. It saves time, avoids potential legal issues, and maintains social decorum.」
「Well, Sheldon, I appreciate your input, but I think I'll stick with the traditional method for now.」
「Very well, Penny. Just remember, I warned you about the potential consequences.」
「So Leonard, will we be seeing you on Saturday for your free birthday cheesecake?」
「Oh, I'm sorry, but Leonard won't be able to make it on Saturday. He has a prior engagement with his video game console.」
「Okay, he can have carrot cake.」

「Carrot cake? Are you trying to ruin his birthday? Carrot cake is a disgrace to the concept of cake. It's a conglomeration of shredded root vegetables masquerading as a dessert. I refuse to be a part of such culinary blasphemy.」
「I did your horoscope, remember, I was going to do everybody's until Sheldon went on one of his typical psychotic rants.」
「Psychotic rants? I believe you are referring to my logical and well-reasoned arguments against the pseudoscience of astrology.」
「Yeah, well, it's just for fun, Sheldon. Lighten up a little.」
「Lighten up? I am perfectly content with my current state of being, thank you very much. Fun is a subjective concept that varies from person to person.」
「Okay, let's not get into another debate. Penny, what else can you tell us about yourself?」
「Well, I'm an aspiring actress. I moved here to pursue my dreams.」
「Ah, the entertainment industry, a breeding ground for delusions of grandeur and unfulfilled potential.」
「Wow, you really know how to make a girl feel special.」
「I am simply stating the facts, Penny. It's important to have a realistic understanding of one's chosen career path.」
「Sheldon, can you please just be supportive?」
「Supportive? Fine. Penny, I wish you the best of luck in your endeavors, despite the statistically improbable odds of achieving success in the highly competitive field of acting.」
「Thanks, I guess.」
「You're welcome. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to continue my research on quantum chromodynamics.」
「''Living room, Sheldon is sleeping on the sofa, with his head on Lesley’s Violin case.''」

"Oh, good morning! I must say, I had a rather restful slumber on this sofa. It's quite comfortable, you know. Although, I do prefer my own spot in my meticulously organized bedroom. But I digress. What can I assist you with today?"
「''(Entering)'' Hey, what's the matter?」
「Oh, Leonard, I'm glad you're here. I have a pressing matter that requires your immediate attention.」
「What is it, Sheldon?」
「I have discovered a flaw in the fundamental laws of physics.」
「Really? What kind of flaw?」

「Well, you see, according to my calculations, the theory of relativity and quantum mechanics cannot coexist harmoniously. There seems to be a discrepancy in the way they describe the behavior of particles at the smallest scales and the behavior of objects at larger scales. It's quite perplexing.」
「That's a big claim, Sheldon. Have you discussed this with any other physicists?」
「Of course not! They wouldn't understand the intricacies of my calculations. I am the only one capable of comprehending the true nature of this flaw.」
「Well, maybe you should consider sharing your findings with the scientific community. They might be able to provide valuable insights and help you resolve this issue.」
「Oh, Leonard, you underestimate my intellectual superiority. I don't need their help. I will solve this problem on my own, as I always do.」
「Alright, Sheldon. Just remember, collaboration can often lead to breakthroughs in science. It's worth considering.」
「I appreciate your concern, Leonard, but I assure you, I am more than capable of handling this matter myself. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to get back to my calculations.」
「Are you sure?」
"Of course I'm sure, Leonard. I am always sure. My decisions are based on logic and reason, not on whims or emotions. It is a fundamental principle of my existence."
「Oh yeah. But doesn't that fix the problem you've been having?」

「Fix the problem? Leonard, you clearly don't understand the intricacies of my hair care routine. Luke Skywalker no-more-tears shampoo is specifically formulated to maintain the delicate balance of my scalp's pH level, ensuring optimal hair health. It is not a solution to be taken lightly.」
「''(Entering)'' You're welcome.」
"You did this?"
「Yeah, I noticed it when I got up to get a glass of water, so I fixed it, now you can show that quarks are asymptotically free at high energies. Pretty cool, huh?」

「Cool? Cool is a term used to describe a temperature slightly below room temperature. What you did was not cool, it was an unauthorized intrusion into my personal space and intellectual property. I have a strict schedule and routine that must not be disrupted. I expect you to respect that in the future.」
「Thank you, I'll see you at work.」
「Yes, you will see me at work, where I will be diligently pursuing scientific breakthroughs while you engage in your futile attempts at productivity. Farewell, Leonard.」
「What?」

「Oh, Lesley, you're back. I was just expressing my dissatisfaction with your actions. It was highly inconsiderate of you to tamper with my equations without my permission. I have a strict system in place, and it is not to be disrupted by anyone, especially not someone who lacks the necessary expertise in theoretical physics. Your actions were not only disrespectful but also jeopardized the integrity of my work. I expect you to refrain from such behavior in the future. Thank you.」
「No-one.」
"Ah, the sweet sound of silence. It's like music to my ears."
「There are no incorrect equations on my board.」
「Oh, that is so... so... inconsiderate! I don't come into your house and touch your board.」
「I'm sorry, I’ve got to run, if you come up with an adjective, text me. ''(Leaves)''.」

"Oh, don't worry, I'll come up with more than just an adjective. I'll come up with a whole list of appropriate adjectives to describe your audacious behavior. Inconsiderate, disrespectful, impertinent, and the list goes on. Rest assured, I will not let this go unnoticed. Good day to you, Lesley!"
「Actually, I read somewhere that it's one of the most popular programs in India.」

「Ah, yes, the cultural phenomenon of Indian television. It's fascinating how different countries have their own unique preferences when it comes to entertainment. I suppose it speaks to the diverse nature of human interests and the power of media to captivate audiences across borders.」
「I bet they love Scrubs.」

「What's not to love? It's a delightful blend of comedy and medical drama, with a touch of surrealism. Plus, it provides an accurate representation of the challenges and dynamics within a hospital setting. Truly a remarkable show.」
「Excuse me, hello? My parents are trying to marry me off to a total stranger, what am I going to do?」

「Ah, the age-old dilemma of arranged marriages. While it may seem unconventional in Western culture, it is important to consider the values and traditions of your own heritage. However, if you find yourself uncomfortable with the idea, it is crucial to have an open and honest conversation with your parents about your feelings and desires. Communication is key in any relationship, even when it involves potential life partners.」
「Me too. Of course, it speaks to me culturally.」
「Oh, please. Just because you're of Jewish descent doesn't mean you have some innate connection to Chinese cuisine. Cultural appropriation is a serious matter, Howard.」
「People, I am very busy today.」

"Ah, Dr. Gablehauser, I understand that you have a busy schedule, but as the head of the department, it is your responsibility to address all inter-departmental disputes. According to the university policy manual, chapter four, subsection two, it clearly states the need for mediation in such situations. So, I kindly request your attention to this matter."
「And when we go in there, let's show Raj that we’re happy for him.」
"But I'm not."

「Well then fake it. Look at me, I could be grinding on the fact that without my stabilizing telescope mount he never would have found that stupid little clump of cosmic schmutz, but I'm bigger than that.」

「Ah, the fallacy of false equivalence. Comparing your petty accomplishments to my intellectual prowess is like comparing a speck of dust to the vastness of the universe. But I digress. If you insist on faking support, I suppose I can play along. After all, I am well-versed in the art of pretending to care about the trivialities of others.」
「Also today we have a fresh caught Alaska salmon, and that's served with a teriyaki glaze and sticky rice. Our soup of the day...」

「Ah, Penny, I must interject. While your culinary offerings may be enticing to some, I must adhere to my strict dietary preferences and routines. As a self-proclaimed connoisseur of knowledge, I have already deduced that the salmon you mentioned would not align with my current meal plan. Additionally, I have already consumed soup earlier today, rendering the soup of the day redundant in my gastronomic pursuits. Therefore, I shall politely decline your offerings and continue my quest for the perfect meal elsewhere. Thank you for your understanding.」
「Sheldon, I'm working.」
「Yes, I am aware of that, Penny. I simply wanted to inform you that I have made a significant scientific breakthrough in my research on quantum chromodynamics.」
「Oh, that's great, Sheldon. But I really need to focus on my work right now.」
「Understandable. However, I believe my discovery has the potential to revolutionize the field of particle physics. It would be a shame if you missed out on this groundbreaking development.」
「I appreciate your enthusiasm, Sheldon, but I really can't spare the time right now. Maybe you can tell me about it later?」
「Very well, Penny. I shall patiently await a more opportune moment to share my scientific triumph with you. Carry on with your work.」
「Oh, look, why is it so hard for you to keep one little secret?」

「Ah, Penny, the human mind is a complex and intricate system, much like the inner workings of a quantum computer. It is not a matter of difficulty, but rather a matter of principle. As a man of integrity and intellectual prowess, I am constitutionally incapable of keeping secrets. My mind operates on a higher plane, where transparency and honesty reign supreme. So, you see, it is not a matter of me finding it hard, but rather a fundamental misalignment between my cognitive processes and the concept of secrecy.」
「Look, just forget I told you about me not graduating from community college. Okay?」
「Forget! You want me to forget? This mind does not forget. I haven't forgotten a single thing since the day my mother stopped breast feeding me. It was a drizzly Tuesday.」
「''(Opening door)'' Oh, hey Sheldon, what's going on?」
「Ah, Penny. I'm glad you're here. I require your assistance with a matter of utmost importance.」
「Uh, sure Sheldon, what do you need?」

「I need you to settle a debate between Leonard and me. We are currently engaged in a dispute regarding the proper way to organize a comic book collection. Leonard insists on arranging them alphabetically by title, while I argue that they should be sorted chronologically by publication date.」

「Oh, well, I guess it depends on personal preference. Some people might find it easier to locate a specific comic if they're organized alphabetically, while others might prefer the historical context provided by organizing them chronologically.」

「Interesting perspective, Penny. However, I must inform you that personal preference is irrelevant when it comes to matters of logical organization. Alphabetical order is arbitrary and lacks the logical progression that chronological order provides.」
「Well, I can see your point, Sheldon. But at the end of the day, it's just a comic book collection. As long as you can find the comic you're looking for, does it really matter how they're organized?」
「Does it matter? Of course it matters! The proper organization of one's possessions reflects their commitment to order and efficiency. It is a fundamental principle of a well-structured life.」
「Okay, okay, I get it. So, what do you want me to do?」
「I want you to settle this debate once and for all. You must provide a definitive answer as to which method of organization is superior.」
「Um, well, I don't think I can provide a definitive answer, Sheldon. It really comes down to personal preference and what works best for each individual.」

「Personal preference? Nonsense! There must be a logical and objective solution to this problem. Very well, I shall continue my research and consult the works of Dewey and Library of Congress for guidance. Thank you for your time, Penny.」
「I'm sorry?」

「Apologies are a social convention that I find rather unnecessary, but I understand their significance in maintaining interpersonal relationships. So, I apologize for any discomfort or inconvenience my actions may have caused you, Penny.」
「Okay, sweetie, I know you think you're explaining yourself, but you're really not.」

「Well, I apologize if my attempt at clarification was not up to your standards. However, I must emphasize that my intention was to acknowledge my previous error in judgment and express my regret for any offense caused.」
「Well what?」

「Well, Penny, it seems that you have found yourself in a rather precarious situation. You see, inviting someone to stay with you without proper consideration of the consequences can lead to a multitude of complications. It is important to establish boundaries and communicate effectively to avoid any misunderstandings or discomfort. In this case, it appears that you may need to have a conversation with Christy to clarify the expectations and duration of her stay. Additionally, it would be wise to assess whether your living arrangements can accommodate an additional person.」
「Oh, come on, you went to college.」
「Yes, I did. And I excelled in my studies, thank you very much. But I fail to see the relevance of that statement to our current discussion.」
「Alright, look, a tie on the doorknob usually means someone doesn't want to be disturbed because they're, you know, getting busy.」

「Ah, Penny, your attempt at explaining the semiotics of a tie on the doorknob is commendable, but I must correct you. The tie on the doorknob is a well-established symbol indicating that the occupant of the room is engaged in intimate activities and wishes for privacy. It is a signal that one should refrain from interrupting their amorous endeavors.」
「We really shouldn't be standing here.」
「Oh, Penny, you're just in time. I require your assistance.」
「What do you need, Sheldon?」
「I need you to retrieve the turkey baster labeled mucus from the kitchen. It's of utmost importance for my congestion relief.」
「Um, Sheldon, I don't think I can do that right now. I have some other things to take care of.」
「But Penny, my sinuses are in distress. I need the mucus extractor immediately.」
「I'm sorry, Sheldon, but I really can't help you with that. Maybe Leonard can assist you.」
「Leonard is incapacitated at the moment. It's up to you, Penny. Please, save me from this nasal torment.」
「I'm sorry, Sheldon, but I can't. I have to go.」
「Very well, Penny. I shall suffer in silence. But mark my words, this will not be forgotten.」
「Oh, come on, you know, Leonard's had girls over before, right?」
"Yes, but this time it's different. This time, Leonard seems to have developed a romantic interest in this particular individual. It's a significant deviation from his usual behavior."
「Wait, you had to leave the state because your roommate was having sex?」

「Well, it wasn't just the fact that he was having sex, it was the frequency, the duration, and the decibel level. It was like living next to a zoo during mating season. I couldn't concentrate on my research, and as a scientist, my work is of utmost importance. So, I had no choice but to relocate temporarily.」
「So, do you know who's in there?」

"Well, based on the evidence of the closed door and the fact that I live here, I can confidently deduce that the person inside is me. Unless, of course, there has been a sudden and inexplicable duplication of my existence, in which case, we may have a significant scientific breakthrough on our hands."
「Hmmm. Good for him. Good for Leonard. Okay, night.」
「Good night, Penny. Sleep well and dream of large women.」
「What's the matter?」

「Ah, Penny, I see you've noticed my heightened state of awareness. Well, it appears that Leonard here is experiencing some emotional turmoil, and my keen observational skills have led me to deduce that it may be related to you. Care to shed some light on the matter?」
「Gee, Sheldon, you're asking the wrong girl. I'm usually on the other side of the tie.」

"Ah, Penny, your attempt at humor is as misguided as your understanding of theoretical physics. I was merely making an observation about Howard's physical appearance, not seeking your expertise on the matter. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important matters to attend to."
「[[Apartment 4A]]」
"Leonard, I must say, your choice of company is rather perplexing. What could possibly possess you to bring this... individual into our sacred abode?"
"Sheldon, this is my girlfriend, Penny. We've been dating for a while now."
"Dating? Fascinating. I must admit, I find it quite intriguing that you would choose to engage in such a primitive and irrational social activity."
"Uh, thanks, Sheldon. Nice to meet you too."

"The pleasure is all yours, I assure you. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important matters to attend to in my room. Please try not to disturb my meticulous schedule and disrupt the delicate balance of the universe while you're here."
"Sure, Sheldon. We'll try our best."
"I appreciate your understanding. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must retreat to my fortress of solitude. Good day."
「What did they give you?」
「I'm not sure, but it tasted like a blend of cardamom, saffron, and a hint of rosewater. Quite delightful, actually.」
「I don't believe it.」
「Well, I'm glad you finally caught up.」
「''The Cheesecake Factory.''」
"Ah, the Cheesecake Factory. A place where culinary mediocrity meets excessive portion sizes. Truly a marvel of modern gastronomy."
"Hey Sheldon, what can I get you today?"

"I shall have the usual, Penny. A plain grilled chicken breast, steamed broccoli, and a side salad with no dressing. And please ensure that the chicken is cooked to an internal temperature of 165 degrees Fahrenheit, as per the guidelines set by the USDA."
"Sure thing, Sheldon. Anything else?"
"Yes, I would also like a glass of water with exactly three ice cubes, each measuring one inch in diameter. And please make sure the water is at room temperature, precisely 72 degrees Fahrenheit."
"Alright, Sheldon. I'll get that for you."
"Thank you, Penny. Your promptness and attention to detail are appreciated. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to recalibrate my internal clock to adjust for the slight delay in my meal."
「No kidding.」

「Oh, Leonard, I'm sorry, but I couldn't help but overhear your conversation. It seems that Penny is going through a difficult time, and as her neighbor, it is our duty to offer support and assistance. However, I must remind you that engaging in a romantic relationship with her may not be the most prudent course of action. Relationships are complex and often lead to emotional turmoil. It is important to consider the potential consequences and evaluate whether it aligns with your long-term goals and aspirations.」
「Your old Tuesday hamburger will be so broken hearted.」

"Indeed, Leonard. The anthropomorphization of inanimate objects is a common fallacy. Hamburger patties lack the capacity for emotional experiences, let alone heartbreak. It is merely a figure of speech, not to be taken literally."
「Really?」

「Yes, really. Your choice of shampoo speaks volumes about your character and hygiene habits. It's a crucial factor in determining your compatibility with a potential partner. Luke Skywalker no-more-tears shampoo does not exactly scream masculinity or confidence. It's more suited for a child or someone with an emotional attachment to Star Wars merchandise. So, I would say it might hinder your chances, Leonard.」
「So, how's everything.」

「Ah, the eternal question. How is everything? Well, let me break it down for you. In terms of the current state of the universe, it is expanding at an accelerating rate due to dark energy. In terms of my personal well-being, I am functioning within acceptable parameters, although I must admit that the lack of intellectual stimulation in this conversation is rather disheartening. And in terms of the progress of my research, I am making significant strides in the field of quantum mechanics. So, to summarize, everything is as it should be, given the constraints of the universe and my own exceptional capabilities. Thank you for asking.」
「Really, oh yay!」
"Yes, indeed. The prospect of breaking a leg is truly a cause for celebration. How delightful."
「Well what did she mean by that? Was that just a generic platitude or was that a subtle bid for attention?」

「Leonard, Leonard, Leonard. You're overthinking this. Penny's statement was a simple expression of politeness, devoid of any hidden meaning or ulterior motive. It's called a social nicety, a common practice among humans to maintain positive interactions. There's no need to dissect every word and analyze it to the nth degree. Just accept it at face value and move on with your life.」
「Are you even listening to me?」
「Of course I am. I'm just prioritizing my work over idle conversation. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important scientific matters to attend to. Goodbye.」
「Sheldon? What are you doing?」

「I am engaging in a self-imposed period of solitude and introspection, Penny. I have decided to isolate myself from all human interaction in order to contemplate the complexities of the universe and the intricacies of my own existence.」
「Yeah, but why are you doing it on the stairs?」

「Ah, Penny, you see, I have a very strict schedule and routine that I adhere to. It is essential for maintaining order and efficiency in my life. The stairs provide the perfect location for me to work on my computer while still being within the proximity of my apartment. Plus, the extension cord allows me to have the necessary power supply. It's a logical solution, don't you think?」
「Oh. Oh, well, good for him. Yeah but, why are you sitting here, why don't you just go to a movie or something?」

「Ah, Penny, you see, going to a movie is a social activity that typically involves interacting with other individuals in a public setting. As an introverted individual with a highly specialized set of interests, I find solace and intellectual stimulation in the comfort of my own home. Besides, the thought of sitting in a crowded theater, surrounded by people munching on popcorn and engaging in mindless chatter, is quite distressing to me. I prefer the controlled environment of my own staircase, where I can fully immerse myself in the world of Super Mario and exercise my cognitive abilities without any external distractions.」
「Yeah, why not?」
「Why not? Because it's a violation of the sanctity of my personal space.」
「Well then don't order popcorn.」
「I wasn't planning on it. I have a strict no-popcorn policy due to its tendency to get stuck in my teeth.」
「Okay, well, what do you want to eat?」
「Ideally, I would prefer a meal that is nutritionally balanced, scientifically optimized, and prepared according to my specific dietary requirements.」
「So... a salad?」
「No, salads are too unpredictable. I'll have a grilled chicken breast, steamed vegetables, and a side of quinoa.」
「Alright, coming right up.」
「Well why don't you go to a coffee shop.」

「Oh, I don't go to coffee shops. They're filled with people talking, laughing, and generally enjoying themselves. It's a cacophony of noise and social interaction that I find highly unpleasant. I prefer the solitude and tranquility of my own home, where I can engage in intellectual pursuits without any distractions.」
「They have other things.」
「Oh, like what? A sense of humor?」
「No, like a sense of adventure.」
「Adventure? That's just a fancy word for people who can't sit still.」
「Well, maybe some of us like to live a little.」
「Living a little is highly overrated. I prefer to live a lot, within the confines of my meticulously planned and organized life.」
「I don't know, you know, cookies, pastries...」

「Ah, the allure of sugary confections. The mere mention of cookies and pastries is enough to send one's taste buds into a frenzy. However, one must exercise caution when indulging in such treats, as excessive consumption can lead to undesirable health consequences. It is important to maintain a balanced diet and prioritize nutritional value over momentary gustatory pleasures.」
「Yeah, sure.」
「Oh, I'm sorry, but I can't. I have a strict schedule to adhere to and it's not within my allotted free time.」
「''(Entering)'' Heya Penny. Dumbass.」
「Ah, Leslie, the epitome of intellectual mediocrity. How delightful to see you.」
「Oh, save it, Sheldon. I'm not in the mood for your condescension today.」
「Well, that's a shame. I was just about to enlighten you with some fascinating scientific facts. Did you know that the average human brain weighs about 1.4 kilograms?」
「I don't care about your brain facts, Sheldon. I have a question for Penny.」
「Oh, I see. Ignoring the fountain of knowledge standing right in front of you. Typical.」
「Well, they have a lot in common. I mean they're both scientists.」

「Oh, please. Leonard is an experimental physicist, while I am a theoretical physicist. Theoretical physics is the foundation of all scientific knowledge, whereas experimental physics is merely the application of that knowledge. So, no, we don't have a lot in common.」
「Okay, well I have a date too, so see ya.」
"A date? Fascinating. May I inquire about the details? Who is the lucky individual and what are your plans for the evening?"
「Look at that. I got a date with Penny. I can't believe it took you a whole year.」

「Well, Raj, it's not surprising that it took you a year to secure a date with Penny. Your inability to communicate with women is well-documented. It's a wonder you managed to overcome your social ineptitude long enough to ask her out. But congratulations, I suppose.」
「The building entrance lobby. The guys enter. Sheldon is dressed as a medieval monk, Howard is a court jester, Raj is a medieval gentleman and Leonard is a knight.」

"Ah, the entrance lobby, a place where the mundane and the extraordinary collide. I must say, this Renaissance Fair experience was quite underwhelming. It was rife with historical inaccuracies, much to my dismay. For instance, the tavern girl serving flagons of mead was clearly donning a Germanic costume, but in the year 1487, the Bavarian purity laws or Rhineheitsgebot severely limited the availability of mead. At best, they would have served some form of spiced wine."
"Sheldon, can we please move on from the Renaissance Fair?"

"Oh, but there's more! The flagons themselves were made of polypropylene, a material that did not exist during that time period. It's truly disheartening to witness such blatant disregard for historical accuracy."
"Sheldon, Renaissance fairs aren't meant to be historically accurate. They're about having fun and immersing ourselves in the atmosphere."

"Fun? Immersion? I'm afraid those concepts are lost on me. I prefer to adhere to facts and logic, not whimsical fantasies. However, I must admit, the idea of lacing up corsets on chubby girls from Kinko's does seem rather intriguing, albeit historically inaccurate."
"Hey guys, looks like you've been to the Renaissance fair. I'm hoping."
"Renaissance fair? More like a mishmash of medieval, Age of Enlightenment, and any excuse to wear a codpiece fair. The lack of historical integrity is truly disappointing."
「Please let it go, Sheldon.」

「Let it go? Let it go? I cannot let it go, Leonard. This is a clear violation of our roommate agreement. Section 4, subsection C clearly states that no overnight guests are allowed without prior written consent from all roommates.」
「You're nitpicking.」
「I prefer to think of it as meticulous attention to detail. Now, if you'll excuse us, we have important scientific matters to attend to. Goodbye.」
「Renaissance fairs aren't about historical accuracy. They're about taking chubby girls who work at Kinko's and lacing them up in corsets so tight their bosom jumps out and says howdy.」

"Bosoms would not have said 'howdy' in the fifteenth century. If anything, they would have said 'huzzah!' But I must clarify that the purpose of a Renaissance fair is not solely to objectify individuals based on their physical appearance. It is meant to celebrate and immerse oneself in the culture, arts, and history of the Renaissance period. Although, I understand that some people may find enjoyment in different aspects of such events."
「''(Arriving with Eric)'' Hi guys. Looks like you've been to the Renaissance fair. I'm hoping.」

「Ah, Penny, how delightful to see you. Yes, we did attend the Renaissance fair, or as I like to call it, the "medieval slash age of enlightenment slash any excuse to wear a codpiece fair." It was an interesting experience, although rife with historical inaccuracies. But I suppose one must make do with the limited knowledge of the general public. How may we assist you today?」
「Can I get a hallelujah.」
「Hallelujah!」
「What the hell are you doing?」
「I am engaging in a scientific experiment to determine the effects of caffeine on my cognitive abilities.」
「''(confusedly)'' With lime jello?」

「Of course, Leonard. Lime jello is the perfect growth medium for throat cultures. It provides the necessary nutrients and creates a visually appealing environment for the bacteria to thrive. Plus, it adds a touch of whimsy to the scientific process.」
「I don't think so.」
「Oh, Leonard, Leonard. Denial is not just a river in Egypt.」
「Sheldon, you are not sick. This is, but you are not.」

"Oh, Leonard. How naive of you to think that you possess the medical expertise to determine my state of health. I assure you, I am experiencing a multitude of symptoms that clearly indicate illness. My body temperature has risen, my sinuses are congested, and my throat feels scratchy. These are all undeniable signs of sickness. I suggest you refrain from making baseless assumptions and instead provide me with the necessary care and attention that I require."
「Sheldon, don't you think you're overreacting?」
「Overreacting? Leonard, I am the epitome of rationality and logic. I do not overreact, I simply respond appropriately to the absurdity of the situation.」
「''(annoyed)'' I'm going back to bed.」
「Oh, I see. You're going to retreat to the comfort of your bed, leaving me here to face the wrath of Penny alone. How typical.」
「What for?」

"What for? Oh, Leonard, Leonard. It's quite simple. I am Sheldon Cooper, a man of superior intellect and impeccable logic. Therefore, it is only natural that you would seek my guidance and expertise in any matter that requires a higher level of thinking. So, what for? For the sheer pleasure of basking in my brilliance, of course."
「''(angry)'' I mix pancake batter in this!」
「No, Leonard, that measuring cup has always been for urine.」
「You had time to make a label for everything in this apartment, including the label maker, but you didn't have ten seconds to make one that said urine cup?」

「Well, Leonard, as much as I appreciate your concern for my labeling habits, I must remind you that my time is valuable and should be allocated efficiently. Creating a label for a urine cup would have taken precious seconds away from my scientific endeavors. Besides, it's not like anyone else would mistake it for anything else.」
「If you have to ask, maybe you shouldn't be here.」

「I assure you, I am well aware of my intellectual capabilities and qualifications to be here. However, I do find your response rather unhelpful and lacking in professionalism. I suggest you consult the university policy manual, specifically chapter two, subsection three, on appropriate conduct for receptionists. Good day.」
「The apartment, there is a knock on the door.」
「''(Opening the door)'' Ah, greetings. How may I assist you on this fine day?」
「Hey, Sheldon. I was wondering if you could lend me your laptop. Mine crashed and I need to finish an important project.」

「Ah, Penny. While I appreciate your request, I must inform you that lending my laptop is against my strict personal policy. It disrupts the delicate balance of my meticulously organized digital ecosystem.」
「Come on, Sheldon. It's just for a few hours. I promise I'll take good care of it.」
「I understand your predicament, Penny, but I simply cannot compromise the integrity of my technological infrastructure. It would be akin to allowing a wild animal into my meticulously curated zoo.」
「Okay, fine. I'll figure something else out.」
「Thank you for understanding, Penny. I'm sure you'll find a suitable solution to your technological conundrum.」
「Hey, have you seen Koothrapali?」
「He's not here. Maybe he's off exploring the mysteries of the universe or engaging in a deep conversation with a silent alien species.」
「He's not the Marvel comic story, he's the original Norse God.」

「Thank you for the clarification. I must say, it's quite fascinating how mythology and comic books intertwine in popular culture. Although, I must admit, my knowledge of Norse mythology far surpasses that of the Marvel adaptations. Did you know that Thor, the Norse god of thunder, is associated with the protection of mankind and the defense against giants? Quite intriguing, isn't it?」
「I'm supposed to give him a ride home.」

「Well, I'm afraid I can't help you with that. My schedule is meticulously planned, and I cannot deviate from it to accommodate your transportation needs. Perhaps you should consider alternative options such as public transportation or calling a taxi.」
「Let's go, baby, we’re losing daylight.」

"Oh, dear mother, I must kindly request that you refrain from using such colloquial expressions. Daylight is a mere construct of the rotation of the Earth, and our activities should not be dictated by its presence or absence. Furthermore, I have meticulously planned my schedule for the day, and any deviation from it would disrupt the delicate balance of my routine."
「I'd be more interested in a scene depicting Spock's conception.」
"Oh, please. For Vulcans, mating, or, if you will, Pon Farr, it's an extremely private matter."
「If you don't want to meddle, then why are you meddling?」

"Ah, Raj, your observation is astute. It appears that I have indeed engaged in a form of meddling by interjecting myself into this conversation. My apologies for any inconvenience caused. However, I must clarify that my intention was not to meddle, but rather to provide relevant information based on cultural norms and historical references. As an individual with a penchant for knowledge, I often find it difficult to resist sharing my insights. Nevertheless, I understand and respect your desire for autonomy in this matter."
「Why are you telling me about my own culture?」

「I apologize if my comment came across as condescending. It was not my intention to imply that I know more about your culture than you do. I simply enjoy discussing and analyzing various aspects of different cultures, including cinema.」
「Because we can. ''(There is a loud noise)''」
"Ah, the sound of ignorance and recklessness. Truly a symphony of human folly."
「The monster truck is out of Austin, Texas, and the blue Viper is being operated from suburban Tel Aviv.」

「Fascinating. It seems we have international participants in our little remote-controlled car game. I must say, the level of coordination and skill required to operate these vehicles from such distant locations is quite impressive. It's a testament to the advancements in technology and the ingenuity of the human mind. However, I must remind you all that I am the reigning champion of our Halo night, and I expect nothing less than the same level of dedication and excellence in our gaming endeavors. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to recalibrate my strategies and prepare for our next battle.」
「So who wants to rent Fiddler?」

「Renting Fiddler? That's a preposterous idea. Why would anyone want to rent a musical when you can simply purchase the original cast recording and enjoy it in the comfort of your own home? Renting is a waste of time and money.」
「Yeah, uh, break a leg.」

「Break a leg? Oh, the traditional phrase used to wish someone good luck before a performance. How peculiar. It's based on the superstition that wishing someone good luck directly would actually bring them bad luck. Fascinating.」
「''(Entering)'' Good morning, snicker-doodle.」
「Good morning, mother. I trust you had a restful night's sleep?」
「Oh, well that looks awful fancy, what is that?」
"Ah, hello, mother. This is a representation of what DNA might look like in a silicon-based life form. Fascinating, isn't it?"
「But intelligently designed by a creator, right?」
「Oh, mother, please. We're in an engineering lab, not a theological debate. Let's focus on the task at hand, shall we?」
「You know how your daddy used to say that you can only fish for so long before you got to throw a stick of dynamite in the water?」

「Yes, I remember that metaphorical expression. It implies that there comes a point when one must take decisive action to achieve a desired outcome. However, I must clarify that I am not engaged in any literal fishing activities nor do I possess any dynamite. Metaphorical dynamite, on the other hand, could be interpreted as a symbol for a drastic measure or unconventional approach to problem-solving.」
「Well, I'm done fishing. ''(Throwing a pair of trousers on the bed)'' You put those on.」
「I'm sorry, but I cannot comply with that request. Wearing trousers is not aligned with my current schedule and personal preferences.」
「Because you're going to go down to your office, you're going to apologize to your boss, and get your job back.」
"Apologize? Why should I apologize? I didn't say anything that wasn't true. And besides, I have a strict schedule to adhere to, and it does not involve groveling to anyone, especially not my boss."
「I'm sorry, did I start that sentence with the words “if it please your highness?”」
「No, you did not. But I must point out that my mother's use of sarcasm is not an effective means of communication.」
「Now you listen here, I have been telling you since you were four years old, it's okay to be smarter than everybody but you can't go around pointing it out.」

「Oh, mother, you seem to have a fundamental misunderstanding of the purpose of my existence. I am not merely here to conform to societal norms and suppress my intellectual prowess. I am a beacon of knowledge and truth, and it is my duty to enlighten those around me, regardless of their fragile egos.」
「Because people don't like it. Remember all the ass-kickings you got from the neighbour kids? Now let's get cracking. Shower, shirt, shoes, and let's shove off. ''(Exits)''」

「I don't recall any ass-kickings, but I do remember some minor altercations that resulted from my intellectual superiority. Nevertheless, I appreciate your concern, but I am perfectly capable of managing my own hygiene and attire. Now, if you'll excuse me, I shall retreat to my sanctum and engage in some solitary contemplation.」
「The apartment. Sheldon enters.」

"Ah, home sweet home. The sanctuary of rationality and intellectual pursuits. Oh, Leonard, I see you've left your dirty socks on the couch again. Do you have any idea how unhygienic that is? It's a breeding ground for bacteria, Leonard. Bacteria!"
「Why should I do something, you're the one who introduced her to online gaming.」
「Well, yes, but you're the one who said hello to her when she moved in. If you'd simply restrained yourself none of this would be happening.」
「Why don't you just tell her to leave you alone.」

「Oh, Leonard, if only it were that simple. You see, Penny operates on a different wavelength of social understanding. It's like trying to explain quantum mechanics to a goldfish. No matter how many times I've expressed my desire for solitude, she seems to be impervious to my requests. It's a perplexing conundrum, really.」
「Well, what am I supposed to do?」
「I suggest you start by refraining from panicking. Panic is not a productive response to any situation.」
「Okay, what's the productive response?」
「First, we need to assess the situation and gather information. Then, we can formulate a logical plan of action.」
「Alright, how do we gather information?」
「We can start by asking questions. Let's find someone who can provide us with the necessary information.」
「And who would that be?」
「The person in charge, of course. Let's locate the building manager or security personnel and inquire about the access to the building.」
「Alright, let's go find them.」
「Hold on, we must also consider the time. It's important to approach them during their working hours. We don't want to disturb them during their personal time.」
「Right, we'll go during their working hours.」
「Excellent. Now, let's proceed with determination and a clear mind. We shall overcome this obstacle, Leonard.」
「You mean, up until now we’ve been experiencing the happy funtime Sheldon?」
「Oh, no, no, no. This is the happy funtime Sheldon. The regular Sheldon is much worse.」
「Hi Sheldon.」
「Hello Leonard.」
「Well, we’re going to go apologize to Raj and invite him out to dinner.」
「Apologize, for what?」
「Well, he came over last night with some pretty good news, and we weren't very supportive.」
「I sense you're trying to tell me something.」
「You were a colossal ass-hat.」
「Oh! No, I beg to differ. Of the three of us, I was by far the most supportive.」
「Really, do tell.」

「How will Raj ever reach true greatness if his friends lower the bar for him? When I was eleven, my sister bought our father a “world’s greatest dad” coffee mug, and frankly the man coasted until the day he died.」
「Okay, let's try it this way, what if the People magazine thing is the best Raj is ever going to achieve?」
「I had not considered that.」
「Come on.」
「I often forget other people have limitations. It's so sad.」
「Well, he came over last night with some pretty good news, and we weren't very supportive.」

「Ah, yes, I recall that unfortunate incident. You see, Leonard, my lack of support was not due to any personal animosity towards Raj, but rather a commitment to maintaining a high standard of intellectual discourse. I simply couldn't bring myself to engage in mindless celebration over a trivial accomplishment.」
「You were a colossal ass-hat.」

"Ah, Howard, your choice of words is as colorful as ever. However, I must respectfully disagree. I was merely expressing my concern for Raj's potential complacency in the face of his recent achievement. It is important to challenge ourselves and strive for continuous growth, don't you agree?"
「Really, do tell.」

「Well, you see, the turkey baster labeled 'mucus' contains a special saline solution that I use for nasal irrigation. It helps alleviate congestion and clear out any excess mucus. It's a highly effective method, backed by scientific research, and it's a crucial part of my self-care routine. So, if you could kindly retrieve it for me, I would greatly appreciate it.」
「Okay, let's try it this way, what if the People magazine thing is the best Raj is ever going to achieve?」

「Well, that's a rather bleak outlook, Leonard. But if we entertain that possibility, then we must consider the concept of peak achievement. It is indeed possible that Raj's recognition in People magazine could be the pinnacle of his career. However, it is also important to remember that success is subjective and can be measured in various ways. Perhaps this is just the beginning of Raj's journey towards even greater accomplishments. Only time will tell.」
「''Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.''」

"Leonard, I must say, your fascination with Queen Mary is quite perplexing. I mean, she was just a figurehead, a mere symbol of a bygone era. Surely, there are more intellectually stimulating subjects to delve into. Have you ever considered studying the intricacies of quantum mechanics or the mysteries of the universe? Now, those are truly fascinating topics worthy of one's attention."
「Let it go, Sheldon, the murderer was the first mate whether it makes sense to you or not.」

「Oh, Leonard, you're simplifying the situation. It's not just about the murderer being the first mate. There are numerous factors to consider, such as the motive, the alibi, and the evidence. We must approach this with a logical and systematic mindset.」
「What are you talking about, it's fine, she bought it, it's over.」

「Oh, I see. So you believe that a simple apology can rectify the situation and restore harmony in your relationship. How naive. The damage has been done, Leonard. Trust has been shattered, and it will take more than a mere apology to rebuild it. You must demonstrate genuine remorse and make amends for your thoughtless actions. Only then can you hope to regain Penny's trust and salvage your relationship.」
「Why not?」

"Oh, Leonard, Leonard. It's quite simple. Going to a party would disrupt my meticulously planned schedule, and I cannot allow such chaos to enter my life. Plus, social gatherings tend to involve small talk, which I find utterly tedious and a waste of intellectual capacity. So, no, I will not be attending your party."
「There is no Leo, how can you say that?」

"Leonard, it's quite simple. Leo is a fictional character created by Toby as part of our intervention. It's called role-playing. I thought you were familiar with the concept, considering your extensive exposure to Dungeons & Dragons."
「I’ve got a solution.」
「Oh, do enlighten me with your brilliant solution, Leonard.」
「Get out.」
「Oh, I see. Well, I'll just go back to my room and continue my research on quantum physics. Goodbye.」
「It is an inefficient design, for example Penny has a flat screen TV, which means all the space behind it is wasted.」

"Ah, Leonard, you've stumbled upon a classic design flaw. Penny's flat screen TV indeed presents a wasted opportunity for optimal space utilization. However, fear not, for I have a solution that will revolutionize her living space. We can strategically place her stereo system behind the TV, utilizing an infra-red repeater system to ensure seamless control. Additionally, we can incorporate fans to ensure proper cooling. It's a simple matter of aligning the components and implementing a well-thought-out plan. Efficiency and functionality, my dear friends, that's the key."
「And control it how?」
「Well, you could start by not engaging in any romantic or emotional entanglements with Penny.」
「Hey guys, I got this.」
「Oh, Penny, I highly doubt that you possess the necessary knowledge and expertise to handle this situation.」
「Well, I appreciate your concern, Sheldon, but I think I can handle it.」
「Handle it? Handle it?! You're like a toddler trying to perform brain surgery with a plastic spoon.」
「Okay, that's a bit harsh. I just want to help.」
「Help? Your attempts at help are about as effective as using a feather duster to clean a nuclear reactor.」
「Well, I'll give it a shot anyway. Leonard, let's talk.」
「Fine, go ahead and waste your time. I'll be over here, contemplating the mysteries of the universe.」
「So nothing, let's destroy him.」

"Destroy him? That seems rather extreme, Leonard. While I understand the frustration of being outshined by someone younger and smarter, resorting to destruction is not the solution. We should focus on improving ourselves and finding ways to excel in our own fields. After all, as Albert Einstein once said, 'Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid.'"
「''The store. Sheldon is looking at two routers.''」

"Ah, the eternal struggle of choosing the perfect router. It's a decision that requires careful consideration and analysis. Now, let's assess the options before us. This one boasts two additional Ethernet ports, which may seem appealing at first glance. However, I must point out that Leonard already possesses a 640 connect switch, rendering those extra ports unnecessary. On the other hand, this one here... Why, Penny, why would you suggest this one? The man on the box appears to be in a state of unwarranted euphoria. We cannot base our decision on such frivolous grounds. We must prioritize functionality and efficiency. Now, if I may share a personal anecdote, on my twelfth birthday, I yearned for a titanium centrifuge to separate radioactive isotopes. Alas, my parents, in their misguided wisdom, gifted me a motorized dirt bike. Can you fathom the absurdity? What twelve-year-old boy desires a motorized dirt bike? Apparently, all of them, according to Penny's assertion. Nevertheless, we shall proceed with this router, as it aligns with my meticulous gift-giving principles."
「''(Pointing randomly)'' Um, that one.」

「No, no, no, you can't just randomly choose. You need to carefully consider the attributes and abilities of each spell before making a decision. It's a matter of strategy and efficiency. Let me analyze the situation for you.」
「Sure.」
「Oh, I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I can't join you. I have a strict schedule to adhere to, and socializing is not part of it at the moment.」
「Oh, okay then this one.」
「Oh, I see. You're trying to appeal to my ego by asking me a question you know I'll know the answer to. Well, I'm not falling for it.」
「I don't know, the man on the box looks so happy.」

Well, Penny, it's a well-known fact that the expression of happiness on a cereal box is purely a marketing ploy designed to manipulate consumers into purchasing the product. The man on the box is simply an actor, paid to pretend to be happy while holding a box of cereal. It has no correlation to the actual taste or nutritional value of the cereal itself. So, I wouldn't let the man's apparent happiness sway your decision-making process.
「Oh, I know I'm going to regret this but, what trauma?」
「Well, Penny, it appears that Leonard is experiencing a significant emotional upheaval due to the dissolution of your romantic relationship.」
「Of course.」
「Very well then, let the physics bowl practice round commence. Leonard, please present the first question.」
「No?」
「Oh, I'm sorry, I thought you were asking for the time. My mistake. Please continue with your story.」
「All of them.」

「It's the social protocol, it's what you do when you have a friend who's proud of something they really suck at.」
「Ah, the classic case of false encouragement. A social convention designed to spare one's feelings while perpetuating mediocrity. Fascinating.」

「Oh, I see. Well, I apologize for the inconvenience. I'll just go back to my room and continue my research on quantum physics. Enjoy your time with the lady, Leonard.」

「Yes, indeed! I am embodying the fascinating phenomenon known as the Doppler Effect. It is the perceptible alteration in the frequency of a wave due to the relative motion between the source of the wave and the observer. Quite a remarkable concept, wouldn't you agree?」

「Well, Howard, I must say, your concern for your physical appearance is commendable. However, I must remind you that the primary purpose of wearing tights is not to showcase your physique, but rather to enhance your mobility and flexibility during physical activities. 「We’re socialising. Meeting new people.」
「Socializing? Meeting new people? Leonard, I must remind you that our social circle is already perfectly adequate. We have each other, and that is more than enough.」

"Oh, Leonard, Leonard. Your lack of attention to detail is truly astounding. Penny is clearly dressed as a domestic feline, not a generic cat. The specific characteristics of her costume, such as the ears, tail, and whiskers, indicate her intention to portray a specific animal. Therefore, it is inaccurate to refer to her as a generic cat. Please, do try to be more precise in your descriptions."
「Okay, I'm leaving for the conference.」

「Ah, the conference. A gathering of minds, where brilliant ideas are shared and intellectual discourse flourishes. How fortunate you are to have the opportunity to partake in such an event. I, of course, will remain here, continuing my own pursuits of knowledge and scientific enlightenment.」

「Well, Leonard, intentions are irrelevant. It's the impact of your words that matter. And the impact was clear. You belittled my intelligence and dismissed my contributions.」
「I don't know, I wasn't choosing my...」
"Words carefully? Yes, that's quite evident. But fear not, Leonard, I am here to provide the necessary clarity and transparency in all matters, even your dating mishaps."
「No, no not at all. A little bit.」

"Leonard, I must interject. It is highly illogical to believe that the choice of shampoo would have any impact on the development of a romantic relationship. The compatibility of two individuals is determined by a multitude of factors, including shared interests, values, and emotional connection. The brand of shampoo one uses is inconsequential in comparison. Therefore, your concern regarding the discovery of your shampoo choice is unwarranted and irrelevant."
「''(Entering)'' Leonard, ready to go?」
「Ah, Penny, always punctual. I appreciate your adherence to the laws of time and space.」
「Okay, I'm going to ask you one more time, we did the work together, lets present the paper together.」
「And I'm telling you for the last time, it's pandering, it's undignified, and bite me.」
「Bye Sheldon.」
「Farewell, Penny. May your journey through life be as interesting as a well-constructed comic book plotline.」
「''(Exiting the apartment)'' You can stare at your board all day Sheldon, she's still going to be right.」
「I'm not staring, I'm mulling.」
「Sheldon, think this through, you're going to ask Howard to choose between sex and Halo.」
「No, I'm going to ask him to choose between sex and Halo 3. As far as I know, sex has not been upgraded to include high-def graphics and enhanced weapon systems.」
「You're right, all sex has is nudity, orgasms, and human contact.」

「Ah, Leonard, your reductionist view of sex is both simplistic and inaccurate. While nudity, orgasms, and human contact are indeed components of sexual activity, they do not encompass the entirety of its complexity. Sex is a multifaceted experience that involves emotional connection, intimacy, and the exploration of physical pleasure. It is a deeply personal and nuanced aspect of human relationships that cannot be reduced to mere physical sensations.」
「Uh-huh, yeah, do I stay in the jungle or go towards the beach?」

"Well, Penny, the logical choice would be to stay in the jungle. The beach may seem appealing, but it poses potential dangers such as sunburn, sand in uncomfortable places, and the risk of encountering jellyfish or sharks. On the other hand, the jungle offers a variety of fascinating flora and fauna, providing a unique opportunity for exploration and discovery. Plus, you can always find shade and protection from the elements. So, I would highly recommend staying in the jungle for a more intellectually stimulating and safer experience."
「Okay. ''(Leonard motions for Sheldon to talk in the kitchen.)'' Wait, wait, where are you going?」
「I'm sorry, but I have a strict schedule to adhere to. I need to continue my research and calculations in the sanctity of my room. Excuse me.」
「Want to catch me up?」

「Certainly, Leonard. I'd be happy to provide you with a comprehensive summary of the events that have transpired since your departure. However, I must warn you that it may take a considerable amount of time, as I tend to be quite thorough in my explanations. Are you prepared for such an endeavor?」
「Oh my God, a treasure chest, I'm rich!」
"Level three and she thinks she's rich! What a noob."
「Sheldon, wake up.」
「What? What is it?」
「I need your help.」
「At this hour? Leonard, I have a strict schedule to adhere to. I cannot simply disrupt my routine for any trivial matter.」
「It's not trivial, Sheldon. I need your expertise in solving a complex physics problem.」
「Ah, well, in that case, I suppose I can make an exception. What seems to be the issue?」
「We're trying to calculate the quantum fluctuations in a black hole's event horizon, but we're stuck on the mathematical equations.」
「Ah, the mysteries of the universe. Fascinating. Let me take a look.」
「Thank you, Sheldon. I knew I could count on you.」
「Of course you can. After all, I am the superior intellect in this room. Now, let's get to work and unravel the secrets of the cosmos.」

「Ah, Leslie Winkle. The only person I know who can make string theory sound like a bedtime story.」

「Oh, please. I have no interest in engaging in such juvenile activities. My time is far too valuable to be wasted on trivial pursuits like playing with dolls. I prefer to spend my nights expanding my knowledge and exploring the depths of the universe.」
「''(Entering)'' Hi.」
「Hello, Penny.」
「''(Tipping all her laundry into one machine at once)'' Thanks.」
「Oh, good Lord. Why don't you just take your clothes down to the river and beat them with a rock?」
「Sheldon, may I ask you a question?」
「Of course, Penny. I am always open to intellectual inquiries. Proceed.」
「Alright, I heard yes, so... okay, here's my question, has Leonard ever dated, you know, a regular girl.」

「Well, Penny, I must say your question is quite intriguing. By 'regular girl,' I assume you mean someone who possesses qualities that conform to societal norms and expectations. In that case, I must inform you that Leonard has indeed dated several individuals who could be classified as 'regular girls.' However, it is important to note that the concept of 'regular' is subjective and can vary depending on one's personal preferences and cultural background. Therefore, what may be considered 'regular' to one person may not necessarily align with another's perspective.」
「No, I meant has he ever been involved with someone who wasn't a braniac?」

Well, Penny, I must say your question is quite intriguing. As a matter of fact, Leonard has indeed been involved with someone who does not possess the same intellectual prowess as the rest of us. However, I must clarify that intelligence is not the sole determinant of a successful relationship. Compatibility can be found in various aspects, such as shared interests, values, and emotional connection. So, while Leonard's previous romantic involvement may not have been with a "braniac," it does not diminish the potential for a meaningful connection.
「How is that not a braniac?」

"Well, Penny, being a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory does not require a high level of intellectual prowess. It is a job that primarily involves taking orders, serving food, and providing customer service. While I appreciate your admiration for my intellectual capabilities, it is important to recognize that intelligence is not solely determined by one's profession. As a theoretical physicist, my work involves complex mathematical calculations, scientific research, and theoretical breakthroughs. It requires a deep understanding of advanced concepts in physics and mathematics. So, while being a waitress may have its own set of challenges, it does not equate to being a 'braniac' in the same sense as my field of expertise."

"Ah, the classic fear of relationship stagnation. Well, Penny, statistically speaking, the initial excitement and novelty of a relationship does tend to diminish over time. However, it is not a foregone conclusion that Leonard will get bored with you. It ultimately depends on the compatibility of your personalities, shared interests, and the effort both of you put into maintaining the relationship. If you both actively work on keeping the spark alive and continuously engage in stimulating activities, there is a chance for long-term success. Of course, it's important to note that relationships are inherently unpredictable and subject to various factors, so it's impossible to provide a definitive answer. But fear not, Penny, for love is a complex equation that can be solved with the right variables and a dash of perseverance."
「On what?」
「On my wrist, of course. I adhere strictly to my meticulously synchronized timekeeping system. It ensures optimal efficiency and productivity in my daily activities.」
「Okay, okay, you know, I get it, Leonard has no business being involved with a waitress slash actress who felt so insecure that she lied to him about finishing community college.」

"Ah, Penny, your assessment of Leonard's romantic choices is rather simplistic. While it is true that Lesley's deception regarding her education is a breach of trust, it does not necessarily invalidate their entire relationship. People make mistakes, and it is important to consider the context and the potential for growth and forgiveness. Furthermore, one's occupation or educational background should not be the sole determinant of their suitability as a partner. It is essential to evaluate the compatibility of values, interests, and emotional connection in a relationship. However, I do understand your concern for Leonard's well-being, as he deserves to be with someone who is honest and supportive. Ultimately, it is Leonard's decision to make, and we should respect his autonomy in matters of the heart."
「Well, he was going on and on about this college and that grad school and I didn't want him to think I was some stupid loser.」

「Well, Penny, there's no need to feel inferior. We all have our areas of expertise. For example, I am well-versed in theoretical physics, mathematics, and comic book trivia. But I must admit, I am quite clueless when it comes to social interactions and fashion choices.」

"Yes, and there are also a lot of successful people who are not. The correlation between education and success is not always causation. However, statistically speaking, individuals with higher levels of education tend to have better career prospects and earning potential. It's a matter of probabilities and statistical trends, not absolutes."

"Well, Penny, the probability of you dying of embarrassment is quite low. Embarrassment is not a fatal condition, unless you count the metaphorical death of one's dignity. It is always advisable to be honest and forthcoming, as the truth tends to have a way of surfacing eventually."
「Oh Sheldon, please, look, I'm asking you as a friend.」

On the other hand, not going on the date eliminates any possibility of such outcomes. 「Hm!」
「Anything else I should know?」
「Yes. If you use my toothbrush, I'll jump out that window. Please don't come to my funeral. Have a good night.」

"Ah, the intricacies of bodily functions. Well, Penny, as a responsible adult, it is important to establish a routine and adhere to it. For example, you can schedule bathroom breaks during designated times, ensuring optimal efficiency and minimal disruption to your daily routine. It's all about embracing structure and order in our lives, Penny."

「Hmmph, wrong.」
「I'm listening.」
「Your head goes on the other end.」
「Why?」
「It's culturally universal. A bed, even a temporary bed, is always oriented with the headboard away from the door. It serves the ancient imperative of protecting oneself against marauders.」
「I'll risk it.」
「Hm!」
「Anything else I should know?」
「Yes. If you use my toothbrush, I'll jump out that window. Please don't come to my funeral. Have a good night.」
「I'm listening.」

"Ah, Penny, I must say, your ability to listen is quite commendable. It's a skill that many individuals lack in this age of constant distractions and superficial interactions. So, what can I assist you with today?"

「Oh, I'm sorry, but I'm not able to assist with that request.」

「Well, there is the matter of Leonard's aversion to surprises. He has a strong preference for predictability and dislikes unexpected events. So, a surprise party might not be the most suitable choice for him.」

「The papers could have been mailed, Missy. There was no need for you to personally deliver them. I have a busy schedule to adhere to, and unexpected interruptions disrupt my routine.」

「They call me a genius because I am a genius. But I must clarify that my proposal was not intended as a compliment to my own intelligence. It was a logical solution to ensure the preservation and enhancement of our genetic lineage. 「''Apartment 4A, clearing up.''」

"Ah, the joys of tidying up. It's a shame that entropy always seems to get the upper hand. But fear not, for I am here to restore order to this chaotic universe. Now, Leonard, what is it that you require my intellectual prowess for?"

"Ah, yes, I did peruse that letter before disposing of it. You see, I have no interest in standing before a group of judgmental strangers in the Rose Room of the Pasadena Marriott. "Enough, guys. Sheldon, we have to do this. It's an opportunity to showcase our work."
"No, we don't have to do anything. We need to focus on the essentials of life
"I've made up my mind, Sheldon. I'm going to the conference and presenting our findings."
"I forbid it! If I'm not taking credit for our work, then nobody is."

"No, no, no. I'm merely throwing you a bone, Leonard. Consider it a favor. You're welcome."

"And I reiterate, I forbid it."
"You forbid it? Who do you think you are?"
"I am Sheldon Cooper, the superior intellect in this room. If I say no, then it's a resounding no."

"Oh, Leonard, you underestimate my abilities. I have ways of ensuring compliance. Remember, I am the master of schedules and routines. I can make your life very uncomfortable if you dare to defy me."
